summary: Chronic illness can cause stress, anxiety, and anger. It is important to seek help and regain control. Learn about coping with chronic illness.

title: Coping with Disasters
summary: No matter how well you prepared, you might feel dazed or numb after going through a disaster. Seek help if the reaction gets in the way of your life.

title: Corneal Disorders
summary: The cornea is a clear layer that covers the front of the eye. It helps the eye focus, and keeps out germs and dust. Read about diseases of the cornea.

title: Corns and Calluses
summary: Corns and calluses are areas of thick skin, usually on the hands and feet. They happen because of repeated pressure or friction. Read about treatment.

title: Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery
summary: Learn about coronary artery bypass surgery (or graft, CABG). It uses blood vessels from other areas of the body to bypass narrowed heart arteries.
alternative_names: Bypass surgery; CABG; Coronary artery bypass graft

title: Coronary Artery Disease
summary: Coronary artery disease (CAD) is the most common type of heart disease. It can lead to angina and heart attack. Read about symptoms and tests.
alternative_names: CAD; Coronary arteriosclerosis; Coronary atherosclerosis; Coronary heart disease

title: Cosmetics
summary: Cosmetics are products you use on your body to clean it, beautify it, or change how it looks. An example is makeup. Read about using cosmetics safely.
alternative_names: Makeup

title: Cough
summary: Coughing helps your body heal or protect itself. There are two types of coughs: acute and chronic. Learn the causes of chronic cough.

title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease 2019)
summary: COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is a respiratory disease caused by a virus. It can be very contagious. Learn about symptoms, prevention, and treatment.
alternative_names: COVID-19; Coronavirus

title: COVID-19 Testing
summary: Learn about the different types of tests for COVID-19, who needs a test, and how and where you can get a test.
alternative_names: COVID-19 Antibody Test; COVID-19 Viral Test; SARS-CoV-2 Testing

title: COVID-19 Vaccines
summary: Learn about the vaccines that have been approved and the vaccination program.

title: CPR
summary: CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) is an emergency technique used on someone whose heart or breathing has stopped. Learn it; you might save a life.
alternative_names: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation

title: Craniofacial Abnormalities
summary: Craniofacial abnormalities (or craniofacial anomalies) are birth defects of the face or head. A common example is cleft lip and palate. Read more.

title: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease
summary: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) is a rare, degenerative brain disorder. CJD progresses rapidly and is fatal. Learn how to prevent CJD.
alternative_names: CJD

title: Critical Care
summary: Critical care (also called intensive care) helps people with life-threatening injuries and illnesses. Learn what to expect and how to prepare.
alternative_names: ICU; Intensive care

title: Crohn's Disease
summary: Crohn's Disease can cause inflammation in any area from the mouth to the anus. Read about medicines, surgery or dietary management to treat symptoms.
alternative_names: Regional enteritis; Regional ileitis

title: Croup
summary: Croup symptoms include difficulty breathing, a barking cough, and a hoarse voice. Children are at the highest risk. Learn more about croup.
alternative_names: Spasmodic croup; Viral croup

title: Cryptosporidiosis
summary: Cryptosporidiosis or Crypto is an illness caused by a parasite that lives in soil, food and water. Learn the common symptoms and what you should do.
alternative_names: Crypto

title: CT Scans
summary: Doctors use CT scans (or CAT scans) to look for broken bones, cancers, blood clots, and more. Learn about the CT scan and what to expect during one.
alternative_names: CAT scan

title: Cushing's Syndrome
summary: Cushing's Syndrome (Hypercortisolism) is a rare hormonal disorder caused by over exposure to the hormone, Cortisol. Lab tests can show if you have it.
alternative_names: Hypercortisolism

title: Cystic Fibrosis
summary: Cystic fibrosis (CF) is an inherited disease of the mucus and sweat glands. The symptoms and severity of CF can vary. Get the facts.
alternative_names: CF

title: Cytomegalovirus Infections
summary: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is a virus found worldwide. Most people with CMV don't need treatment. Learn about who is at risk and how to prevent infection.
alternative_names: CMV

title: Dandruff, Cradle Cap, and Other Scalp Conditions
summary: Dandruff, flaking of skin on your scalp, can be annoying and itchy. Learn about how to treat it, as well as cradle cap and other scalp conditions.
alternative_names: Seborrhea; Seborrheic Dermatitis

title: DASH Eating Plan
summary: The DASH eating plan helps lower high blood pressure. It recommends eating fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, and limiting salt, bad fats, and sweets. Learn about this heart-healthy eating plan.
alternative_names: DASH Diet; Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension

title: Deep Vein Thrombosis
summary: Deep vein thrombosis (DVT), is a blood clot that forms in a vein deep in the body, often in the leg. Learn about the causes, symptoms, and treatments.
alternative_names: DVT

title: Degenerative Nerve Diseases
summary: Neurodegenerative (degenerative nerve) diseases are disorders that destroy motor neurons. Parkinson's is an examples. See a list of all the diseases.
alternative_names: Neurodegenerative diseases

title: Dehydration
summary: Dehydration means your body doesn't have enough fluid. Learn about the signs and symptoms of dehydration, and what to do about it.

title: Delirium
summary: Delirium is a mental state in which you are confused, disoriented, and not able to think or remember clearly. It is often temporary and treatable.

title: Dementia
summary: People with dementia have serious problems with two or more brain functions, such as memory and language. Affects the ability to do normal activities.
alternative_names: Senility

title: Dengue
summary: Dengue is an infection caused by a virus. You can get it if an infected mosquito bites you. Learn more about risk and prevention.
alternative_names: Break-bone fever; Dengue fever

title: Dental Health
summary: Investing in dental health can yield many benefits. Discover a list of simple ways to keep your oral health on track.
alternative_names: Oral health

title: Dentures
summary: Dentures are false teeth made to replace lost teeth. Dentures can be partial or complete. Read more about how to properly care for and adjust to them.
alternative_names: False teeth

title: Depression
summary: Depression is a serious medical illness. It affects almost 7 percent of U.S. adults. It causes feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and frustration that do not go away. Learn about treatments.
alternative_names: Clinical depression; Dysthymic disorder; Major depressive disorder; Unipolar depression

title: Developmental Disabilities
summary: Developmental disabilities can be physical, mental, or both. The problems are usually life-long, but therapy can help. Learn more.

title: Diabetes
summary: Diabetes is a chronic health condition in which your blood glucose levels are too high.  There is no cure, but diet, exercise, medications, and weight control can help.
alternative_names: DM; Diabetes mellitus

title: Diabetes and Pregnancy
summary: Some people already have diabetes before they get pregnant. When the disease develops during pregnancy, it is called gestational diabetes. It can be managed.
alternative_names: Gestational diabetes

title: Diabetes Complications
summary: Diabetes affects body functions. Complications include skin problems, digestive problems, sexual dysfunction, and problems with your teeth and gums.
alternative_names: Diabetic complications

title: Diabetes in Children and Teens
summary: Children and teens can get Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes. Learn the differences between the two.

title: Diabetes Insipidus
summary: Diabetes insipidus (DI) causes frequent urination. Read about DI's associated urination cycle and how your kidneys handle the fluids
alternative_names: DI

title: Diabetes Medicines
summary: Diabetes medicines can help to control your Diabetes. The right medicines depend on factors such as the type of Diabetes you have.

title: Diabetes Type 1
summary: If the pancreas doesn't make needed insulin, causing blood sugar levels to be too high you have type 1 or juvenile diabetes. Learn the signs.
alternative_names: Insulin-dependent diabetes; Juvenile diabetes; Type I diabetes

title: Diabetes Type 2
summary: Type 2 Diabetes, previously referred to as Adult Onset Diabetes, is the more common type. Risk factors include obesity and family history.
alternative_names: Type 2 Diabetes

title: Diabetic Diet
summary: If you have diabetes, healthy eating helps keep your blood sugar in your target range. Learn how you can still have great tasting food with diabetes.

title: Diabetic Eye Problems
summary: Diabetic eye problems such as diabetic retinopathy can harm your vision and sometimes cause blindness. It is important to manage your diabetes and get regular eye exams.
alternative_names: Diabetic retinopathy

title: Diabetic Foot
summary: Over time, high blood sugar from diabetes can damage your nerves or blood vessels. This can lead to foot problems. Know how to care for diabetic feet.

title: Diabetic Heart Disease
summary: Diabetes puts you at risk for heart disease. There are different types of diabetic heart disease; Some people have no signs or symptoms.

title: Diabetic Kidney Problems
summary: Diabetes is the most common cause of kidney failure in the U.S. Kidney damage from Diabetes is called Diabetic Nephropathy.
alternative_names: Diabetic nephropathy

title: Diabetic Nerve Problems
summary: Damaged nerves caused by Diabetes is called Diabetic Neuropathy. Over half of people with Diabetes get it. Your doctor can test if you have it.
alternative_names: Diabetic neuropathy

title: Diagnostic Imaging
summary: Diagnostic imaging lets doctors look inside your body for clues about a medical condition. Read about the types of images and what to expect.
alternative_names: Imaging

title: Dialysis
summary: Hemodialysis and Peritoneal Dialysis are two types of dialysis that filter your blood to rid your body of harmful waste. Read more about each type
alternative_names: Renal dialysis

title: Diarrhea
summary: Diarrhea can range from mild to severe and can be dangerous in children. Find out what you can do to treat symptoms and when to call your doctor.
alternative_names: Dysentery; The runs; The trots

title: Dietary Fats
summary: Fat is not always bad for you. In fact, you need some fat in your diet. Learn about healthy fats and what to avoid.
alternative_names: Lipids; Monounsaturated fat; Polyunsaturated fat; Saturated fat

title: Dietary Fiber
summary: Fiber helps control your weight by making you feel full faster. It also helps prevent constipation. Learn more about fiber and high fiber foods.
alternative_names: Bulk; Roughage

title: Dietary Proteins
summary: You need to eat protein every day. How much depends on your age, sex, and physical activity. Learn about types of protein and high protein foods.

title: Dietary Supplements
summary: Dietary supplements include vitamins and minerals. Get the facts about dietary supplements and how to use them safely.

title: Diets
summary: Many people follow diets to lose weight. Some diets are fad or crash diets that rarely lead to long term weight loss. Learn about what works.

title: Digestive Diseases
summary: Learn about digestive disorders and how your gastrointestinal (GI) system works. Find out what tests you need in case you sense a problem.
alternative_names: Gastrointestinal diseases

title: Diphtheria
summary: Diphtheria is a bacterial infection spread through contact with an infected person or object. Diphtheria usually affects the nose and throat.

title: Disabilities
summary: About one in five people in the U.S. has a disability. Some people are born with one. Others have them because of an illness or injury. Learn more about available resources.

title: Disaster Preparation and Recovery
summary: Preparing for a disaster can reduce the fear, anxiety and losses that disasters cause. Learn how to be ready.

title: Dislocated Shoulder
summary: A dislocated shoulder is an injury that happens when the top of upper arm bone pops out of the socket in your shoulder blade. It is painful and serious, and should be treated right away. Learn more.

title: Dislocations
summary: Dislocations are joint injuries that force bones out of position. A dislocation is a medical emergency. Learn about treatment and rehabilitation.

title: Diverticulosis and Diverticulitis
summary: Diverticulosis is a condition in which you have small pouches in your colon. If the pouches get inflamed or infected, it's called diverticulitis. Learn more.
alternative_names: Diverticular disease

title: Dizziness and Vertigo
summary: Get the facts on symptoms, causes, and treatments for dizziness. Know how dizziness differs from vertigo, which is feeling that the room is spinning.

title: Down Syndrome
summary: About 1 in 700 babies are born with the birth defect known as Down Syndrome. Learn about the different Down Syndrome types and related health issues.
alternative_names: Trisomy 21

title: Drinking Water
summary: Are you drinking enough water? How can you be sure your drinking water is safe? Learn about drinking water.

title: Drowning
summary: Did you know a person can drown in a puddle of water? Learn more about drowning and how to stay safe in the water.

title: Drug Reactions
summary: If you take prescription or over the counter medicines, be aware of possible drug reactions. Learn about drug interactions, side effects, and more.
alternative_names: Side effects

title: Drug Safety
summary: Be safe when you take medicines. Find out about drug safety.

title: Drug Use and Addiction
summary: Drugs include prescription and over-the-counter medicines, alcohol, tobacco, and illegal substances. Their repeated use or misuse can lead to addiction.
alternative_names: Drug Abuse; Substance Use

title: Drugs and Young People
summary: Drug use or misuse is especially dangerous for young people. Drug use can interfere with developmental processes in the brain, and lead to other health problems.

title: Dry Mouth
summary: Everyone has a dry mouth (Xerostomia) once in a while. But if it's frequent, it can lead to serious health problems. Find a list of common symptoms.
alternative_names: Xerostomia

title: Dual Diagnosis
summary: Many people with a mental illness also have problems with substance abuse. This is called dual diagnosis, or co-occuring disorders. Learn more.

title: Dwarfism
summary: A dwarf is a person of short stature - under 4' 10" as an adult. Many conditions can cause dwarfism but Achondroplasia causes about 70 percent.
alternative_names: Little person

title: Dystonia
summary: Dystonia is a movement disorder. It causes involuntary, often painful, contractions of your muscles. Learn about causes, symptoms, and what can help.

title: E-Cigarettes
summary: Smoking e-cigarettes, or vaping, may not be as safe as you might think. An e-cigarette contains nicotine which is harmful to your health. Learn more.
alternative_names: E-Cigs; Electronic Cigarettes; Personal Vaporizer

title: E. Coli Infections
summary: E. Coli infections are caused by a bacteria. An E. Coli infection can make you feel sick. Learn about E. Coli symptoms, treatment, and more.
alternative_names: Escherichia coli

title: Ear Disorders
summary: Some ear disorders can result in hearing problems and deafness. Find out which conditions can affect your hearing and balance.

title: Ear Infections
summary: Ear infections are common in children. The infection usually affects the middle ear and is called otitis media. Learn what to look out for.
alternative_names: Otitis media

title: Earthquakes
summary: Learn how to protect your family and home from the effects of an earthquake.

title: Eating Disorders
summary: Did you know that more women than men have eating disorders? Learn more about eating disorders such as bulimia, anorexia, and binge eating.
alternative_names: Anorexia nervosa; Binge eating; Bulimia

title: Ebola
summary: Ebola, a type of hemorrhagic fever, is a rare and often deadly disease caused by several different types of Ebola viruses. Learn about treatment and prevention.
alternative_names: Ebola disease; Ebola hemorrhagic fever; Ebola virus disease

title: Ectopic Pregnancy
summary: In an ectopic, or tubal, pregnancy, a fertilized egg grows outside of the uterus. It can be dangerous for the mother. Know the symptoms to watch for.
alternative_names: Abdominal pregnancy; Tubal pregnancy

title: Eczema
summary: Eczema is a general term for different types of rashes. Atopic dermatitis, the most common type, is an allergic skin reaction. Read about treatments.
alternative_names: Dermatitis

title: Edema
summary: Edema is swelling caused by fluid in your tissues. It can be anywhere in the body, but is often in the feet and legs. Learn the causes and treatments.
alternative_names: Dropsy

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
summary: People with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS) usually have very flexible joints and stretchy skin because of weakened connective tissue. Find out more.
alternative_names: Cutis elastica; EDS

title: Elbow Injuries and Disorders
summary: Many things can make your elbow hurt. Common problems are tendinitis, bursitis, and arthritis. Read more about elbow injuries and elbow disorders.

title: Elder Abuse
summary: Seniors are vulnerable to physical or emotional abuse. Elder abuse can happen at home or in assisted living facilities or nursing homes.

title: Electrical Injuries
summary: Electrical injuries are caused by contact with electricity. They include burns and damage to organs, bones, muscles, and nerves. Read about first aid.
alternative_names: Electric shock; Electrical burn

title: Electromagnetic Fields
summary: There are many sources of electromagnetic fields.  Some people worry about EM exposure and cancer, but research is inconclusive. Learn more.
alternative_names: EMFs

title: Emergency Medical Services
summary: Emergency medical services (EMS) can save lives. 911 is an example. Be prepared for serious medical situations by learning more.

title: Emphysema
summary: Emphysema is a type of COPD. COPD makes it hard to breathe. The most common cause of Emphysema is smoking. Learn about symptoms and treatment.

title: Encephalitis
summary: Encephalitis is inflammation of the brain, often caused by a viral infection. There are several types of Encephalitis.  Read about their symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment.

title: End of Life Issues
summary: Although it can be hard, planning for and making decisions about the end of life is important. Doing it ahead of time can reduce stress for you and your family.
alternative_names: Death and dying; Terminal care

title: Endocarditis
summary: Endocarditis, or infective endocarditis (IE), is inflammation of the inner lining of the heart. Learn the causes, who's at risk, and how it's treated.

title: Endocrine Diseases
summary: The Endocrine system has eight major glands that make hormones. Diabetes is the most common endocrine disease in the USA.

title: Endometriosis
summary: Endometriosis happens when tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows in other places in the body. There is no cure but there are treatments for symptoms.
alternative_names: Endo

title: Endoscopy
summary: Endoscopy is a procedure that lets your doctor look inside your body. Read more about how endoscopy works and why it's done.

title: Enlarged Prostate (BPH)
summary: Enlarged prostate, or benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), is a common problem in men over 50. Learn about the symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: benign prostatic hyperplasia

title: Environmental Health
summary: There are hidden dangers in the environment that can affect our health.  Find out about environmental health, including man-made and natural risks.

title: Eosinophilic Disorders
summary: Eosinophils, a type of white blood cell, fight infections and play a role in allergic reactions. In eosinophilic disorders, too many cells build up.
alternative_names: Eosinophilia

title: Eosinophilic Esophagitis
summary: Eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) is a disease in which eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) build up in your esophagus. It causes damage and inflammation. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis, treatment.
alternative_names: EoE; Eosinophilic Oesophagitis

title: Epilepsy
summary: Epilepsy is a brain disorder that causes people to have seizures. The seizures may be mild or severe.  Learn about causes, diagnosis, and treatment.

title: Erectile Dysfunction
summary: Men with erectile dysfunction (ED), or impotence, have trouble getting or keeping an erection. It is more common in older men. Learn about treatment.
alternative_names: ED; Impotence

title: Ergonomics
summary: Ergonomics is a science that helps improve products, processes and tools to help people work and live better and to prevent injury. Find out how.

title: Esophageal Cancer
summary: Early esophageal cancer does not have symptoms. Factors that increase risk include heavy drinking and smoking. Learn how you can reduce your risk.

title: Esophagus Disorders
summary: You esophagus is the tube that carries food and liquids from your mouth to your stomach. Esophagus problems include GERD (reflux), cancer, esophagitis, and spasms. Learn about symptoms and treatments.

title: Evaluating Health Information
summary: How do you know if health information you read can be trusted? Evaluating health information helps you know if the source is reliable. Learn more.

title: Exercise and Physical Fitness
summary: Exercise is one of the most important things you can do for your health. The key is to find the right exercise for you. Get the facts about fitness.

title: Exercise for Children
summary: Your child needs plenty of exercise to be healthy. Find out about the right amount of exercise for your child, safe exercise, and more.

title: Exercise for Older Adults
summary: As we age, exercise becomes more challenging. But it is important for older adults to get enough exercise. How much exercise do you need? Find out.
alternative_names: Seniors' fitness

title: Eye Cancer
summary: Eye cancer is rare. Learn about symptoms, treatments and the different types, including retinoblastoma. It most often affects young children.

title: Eye Care
summary: There are many things you can do to keep your eyes healthy. To help protect your vision, wear sunglasses, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and have regular eye exams.
alternative_names: Eye health; Eye safety

title: Eye Diseases
summary: Some eye problems are minor and go away. Others can cause vision loss. Learn about diseases of the eye, including symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment.

title: Eye Infections
summary: Eye infections can be caused by bacteria, fungi, or viruses. Learn about the different types, including styes, and their symptoms and treatment.

title: Eye Injuries
summary: Eye injuries can cause eye strain, or be serious enough to damage your vision. Read about common causes, prevention, first aid, and other treatments.

title: Eye Movement Disorders
summary: Learn about eye movement disorders, such as strabismus, where the eyes point in different directions, and nystagmus, which causes rapid eye movements.

title: Eye Wear
summary: You may wear glasses or contact lenses to correct your vision, or goggles to protect your eyes. These are types of eye wear. Read about using them.
alternative_names: Contact lenses; Eyeglasses

title: Eyelid Disorders
summary: Your eyelids help protect your eyes. But they can droop, twitch, or become infected or inflamed. Learn about eyelid disorders and their treatment.

title: Facial Injuries and Disorders
summary: Face injuries and disorders can cause pain and affect how you look. In severe cases, they affect sight, speech, breathing and ability to swallow.

title: Fainting
summary: Fainting, or syncope, is a brief loss of consciousness when blood flow to the brain suddenly drops. Know the causes and what to do if someone faints.
alternative_names: Syncope

title: Falls
summary: We all fall down sometimes. Most of the time falls are not serious. But some falls can be dangerous. Learn  how to prevent falls.

title: Family History
summary: Your family history should be more than making a family tree. It also includes learning about your family's health. Learn more.

title: Family Issues
summary: There is no such thing as a typical family. Learning about family issues might help you and your family resolve conflicts and communicate better.

title: Fatigue
summary: Are you tired? Find out about some of the common and uncommon causes of fatigue and how to help yourself.
alternative_names: Tiredness; Weariness

title: Fatty Liver Disease
summary: With fatty liver disease, fat builds up in your liver. Learn about the two types: one is caused by heavy drinking and the other has an unknown cause.
alternative_names: Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease; Alcoholic Steatohepatitis; NAFLD; NASH; Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease; Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis

title: Female Infertility
summary: Infertility is when a woman can't get pregnant after a year or keeps having miscarriages. Read about female infertility, its causes, and treatments.

title: Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders
summary: Drinking alcohol while pregnant can result in fetal alcohol spectrum disorders. The most severe is fetal alcohol syndrome. Learn the risks and   available treatments and therapies.
alternative_names: FASD

title: Fetal Health and Development
summary: You want your baby to be healthy as she grows during each trimester. Find out about fetal health and development.

title: Fever
summary: Are you running a temperature? Learn what can cause a fever and how to know when a fever can be dangerous.
alternative_names: Pyrexia

title: Fibromyalgia
summary: Fibromyalgia (FMS) is a chronic or long-term condition characterized by pain and tenderness all over the body. Learn about symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: FMS; Fibro

title: Fifth Disease
summary: Fifth disease (erythema infectiosum) is a mild infection caused by parvovirus B19. It mostly affects children. Read about symptoms and what can help.
alternative_names: Erythema infectiosum; Parvovirus B19 infection

title: Financial Assistance
summary: Sometimes we may need help with our medical bills or health insurance premiums. Find out about financial assistance available to you.

title: Finger Injuries and Disorders
summary: If you've ever smashed a finger or two accidentally, you know how hard it is to return to your daily tasks. Learn about finger injuries and disorders.

title: Fire Safety
summary: Fires can spread in the home very quickly. Do you know if you're prepared in the event of a fire? Find out about fire safety.
alternative_names: Fire prevention

title: First Aid
summary: Accidents happen! Are you prepared? Learn about what you need in your first aid kit and how to help if someone is injured.

title: Fistulas
summary: An abnormal connection between two body parts is called a fistula. Treatment depends on the location of the fistula. Read more about them here.

title: Floods
summary: Floods can happen in the blink of an eye. Learn how to prepare yourself and your family in the event of a flood.

title: Flu
summary: The flu can cause serious illness in people over 65, babies, and people with certain chronic illnesses. The best way to prevent the flu is to get a vaccine.
alternative_names: Grippe; Influenza; Seasonal flu

title: Flu Shot
summary: The flu shot causes your body to develop antibodies against influenza viruses. Know more about getting vaccinated against getting the flu.
alternative_names: Flu vaccine

title: Fluid and Electrolyte Balance
summary: How do you know if your fluids and electrolytes are in balance? Find out.

title: Folic Acid
summary: If you are pregnant, your doctor has probably talked to you about folic acid. This important B vitamin is also important for everyone. Learn more.
alternative_names: Folacin; Folate; Pteroylglutamic acid; Vitamin B9

title: Food Allergy
summary: Food allergy is an abnormal response triggered by your body's immune system. The reaction may be mild or severe (anaphylaxis). Learn more.

title: Food Labeling
summary: Most packaged foods in the U.S. have food labels. The label can help you eat a healthy, balanced, diet. Learn more.
alternative_names: Nutrition labeling

title: Food Safety
summary: Safe steps in food handling, cooking, and storage can prevent foodborne illness. Learn the four basic steps to food safety.

title: Foodborne Illness
summary: Many pathogens and bacteria can contaminate what we eat and cause food poisoning. Find out the food and germs most associated with foodborne illness.
alternative_names: Food Poisoning

title: Foot Health
summary: Have you been taking good care of your feet? Learn how to select the right footwear and how to practice healthy foot care on the Foot Health topic.

title: Foot Injuries and Disorders
summary: Your feet take a beating during long walks, runs or daily routines. If you're feeling foot pain, learn about foot injuries and disorders right here.

title: Foreign Bodies
summary: If you've ever gotten a splinter or had sand in your eye, you've had experience with a foreign body. Many do not cause serious harm. Learn more.

title: Fractures
summary: A fracture is a partial or complete break in the bone. There are different causes and types of fractures. Symptoms include intense pain, swelling and bruising.
alternative_names: Broken bone

title: Fragile X Syndrome
summary: Fragile X syndrome is caused by a change in a gene and is passed from parent to child. Learn about symptoms and effects of this genetic disorder.
alternative_names: FRAXA; FXS

title: Friedreich Ataxia
summary: Friedreich ataxia (FA) is an inherited disease that damages your nervous system. Symptoms usually begin between ages 5 and 15. Learn the symptoms.

title: Frostbite
summary: Did you know that frostbite can cause permanent damage? Learn how to identify frostbite symptoms and what to do if you think you have frostbite.

title: Fungal Infections
summary: Fungal infections, or mycoses, are caused by fungi. Many are mild and easy to treat, but others are very serious. Read about the types and treatments.
alternative_names: Mycoses

title: G6PD Deficiency
summary: Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency is a genetic disorder that is most common in males. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis and treatment.
alternative_names: Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency

title: Gallbladder Cancer
summary: Gallbladder cancer is difficult to diagnose because there are no symptoms in its early stages. Read about tests, treatment options and prognosis.

title: Gallbladder Diseases
summary: Gallbladder diseases begin when something blocks the flow of bile through the bile ducts. Uncover more facts about Gallbladder and its associated conditions.

title: Gallstones
summary: Gallstones (Cholelithiasis) form when substances in bile harden. Stones that block bile ducts can cause gallbladder attacks. Find out who is at risk.
alternative_names: Cholelithiasis

title: Gangrene
summary: Gangrene is the death of tissues in your body, due to a lack of blood flow. It is a serious condition. Learn the symptoms, causes, and treatment.

title: Gas
summary: Passing gas can be embarrassing. But everyone does it. Find out the causes of gas and how to control burping and flatulence.
alternative_names: Belch; Burp; Eructation; Flatulence; Flatus

title: Gastroenteritis
summary: Stomach flu (gastroenteritis) is an inflammation of the intestines that causes diarrhea, pain, vomiting or fever. Learn what you can do to prevent it.
alternative_names: Stomach flu

title: Gastrointestinal Bleeding
summary: Gastrointestinal bleeding can be a a signal of a serious disease. Find out about GI tract symptoms, tests, and related conditions.
alternative_names: GI bleeding

title: Gaucher Disease
summary: Gaucher disease is a rare, inherited disorder in which you do not have enough of an enzyme called glucocerebrosidase. Learn about the three types.

title: Genes and Gene Therapy
summary: Genes are the building blocks of inheritance. Read more about genes and the currently experimental technique of gene therapy.

title: Genetic Brain Disorders
summary: Genetic brain disorders affect the development and function of the brain. Some are inherited, some are caused by exposure, and others are both.
alternative_names: Inborn genetic brain disorders

title: Genetic Counseling
summary: Genetic counseling provides support to people who have or may be at risk for genetic disorders. There are many reasons to seek genetic counseling.

title: Genetic Disorders
summary: A mutation in a person's genes can cause a medical condition called a genetic disorder. Learn about the types and how they are detected.

title: Genetic Testing
summary: Genetic tests are tests on blood and other tissue to find genetic disorders. Over 2000 tests are available. Read about why you might consider testing.

title: Genital Herpes
summary: Genital herpes is a sexually transmitted disease caused by a herpes simplex virus (HSV). Learn about symptoms, testing, prevention, and treatments.
alternative_names: Herpes genitalis

title: Genital Warts
summary: Genital warts are a sexually transmitted disease caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). Learn about what they look like, prevention, and treatment.
alternative_names: Condylomata acuminate; Venereal warts

title: GERD
summary: If you have painful burning in your throat, you may have GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease). Identify symptoms and learn how to treat it.
alternative_names: Gastroesophageal reflux disease

title: Germs and Hygiene
summary: Stopping the spread of germs is as easy as thoroughly washing your hands or covering your mouth when you sneeze or cough. Raise your hygiene IQ here.

title: Giant Cell Arteritis
summary: Giant cell arteritis causes inflammation and narrowing of the arteries in the head. It often occurs with the disease polymyalgia rheumatica. Learn more.

title: Giardia Infections
summary: Giardiasis is an illness caused by a parasite. Diarrhea is the main symptom of giardia infection. Learn about who is at risk and how to treat it.

title: Glaucoma
summary: Glaucoma damages the eye's optic nerve. It is more common in seniors, and can cause blindness. Read about the types, and diagnosis, and treatment.

title: Global Health
summary: The spread of a disease does not stop at a country's borders. Read about the common diseases that impact global health such as HIV and malaria.
alternative_names: International health

title: Gluten Sensitivity
summary: Gluten sensitivity or intolerance is different from celiac disease, though some symptoms may be similar. Find information here on gluten-free diets.
alternative_names: Gluten Intolerance

title: Gonorrhea
summary: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted disease that men and women can get. It doesn't always cause symptoms. Read about testing, prevention, and treatment.
alternative_names: The clap

title: Gout
summary: Gout or gouty arthritis causes swollen, red, stiff joints. Gout is common but can be hard to diagnose. Get the facts on gout symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: Gouty arthritis

title: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
summary: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), previously known as Wegener's granulomatosis is a type of vasculitis, or inflammation of the blood vessels.
alternative_names: GPA; Wegener's Granulomatosis

title: Growth Disorders
summary: Growth disorders affect a child's development. The pituitary gland makes growth hormone. Abnormal growth can signal a gland problem or disease.

title: Guide to Good Posture
summary: Good posture is important for your health as well as you appearance. Get tips on improving your posture, whether you are sitting, standing, or moving.

title: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
summary: Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) causes your immune system to attack your peripheral nervous system. Learn about the causes, symptoms, and what can help.
alternative_names: Acute idiopathic polyneuritis; Acute inflammatory polyneuropathy; Infectious polyneuritis; Landry-Guillain-Barre syndrome

title: Gum Disease
summary: Many adults have some form of gum disease (also known as periodontal disease). Read about the most common gum inflammation, called gingivitis.
alternative_names: Periodontal disease

title: H1N1 Flu (Swine Flu)
summary: Swine Flu is a virus that pigs can get, but human infections can and do happen. H1N1 is the name of a strain that infected people in 2009. Learn more.
alternative_names: Swine flu

title: Haemophilus Infections
summary: Haemophilus is the name of a group of bacteria that can cause serious disease, such as Hib. There is a vaccine to prevent Hib. Learn more.

title: Hair Loss
summary: There are many causes for hair loss. One is alopecia areata, a disease that affects the hair follicles. Read about it and other hair loss issues here.
alternative_names: Alopecia

title: Hair Problems
summary: You have hair all over your body, not just on your head. Find out about what's normal, how to care for hair, and common hair problems.

title: Hand Injuries and Disorders
summary: Find out what you can do if you are experiencing problems with your hands such as pain or stiffness. Learn about hand injuries and disorders.

title: Hantavirus Infections
summary: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome (HPS) is a rare but deadly viral infection. It is spread by mice and rats. Learn about symptoms and prevention.
alternative_names: HPS; Hanta virus

title: Hay Fever
summary: Hay fever (Pollen Allergy) is a type of allergy triggered by pollen from trees, weeds and grasses. Learn the symptoms.
alternative_names: Pollen allergy

title: HDL: The "Good" Cholesterol
summary: HDL, or high-density lipoprotein, is the "good" cholesterol. It helps to remove bad cholesterol from your arteries, so a higher HDL level is better.
alternative_names: High-density lipoprotein

title: Head and Neck Cancer
summary: Head and neck cancer includes cancers of the mouth, nose, sinuses, salivary glands, throat, and lymph nodes. Read the different symptoms of each type.

title: Head Injuries
summary: It is important to know the warning signs of a moderate or severe head injury. Learn when to seek medical attention.
alternative_names: Cranial injuries; Skull fractures; Skull injuries

title: Head Lice
summary: Could that itchy, tickly feeling on your head be head lice? Learn about these tiny insects, such as how to tell if you have them, and how to treat it.
alternative_names: Pediculosis

title: Headache
summary: Nearly everyone has had a headache, the most common form of pain. Learn the different types, the different symptoms of, and when to see a doctor.

title: Health Checkup
summary: Regular health exams and tests can help find problems before they start. Learn about what you can do to make the most of your next check-up.
alternative_names: Annual checkup; Annual physical examination; Routine physical examination

title: Health Disparities
summary: Health disparities refer to differences in the health status of different groups of people. Read more.

title: Health Facilities
summary: Health facilities are places that provide health care such as hospitals, clinics, outpatient care centers, and specialized care centers. Learn more.
alternative_names: Health care facilities

title: Health Fraud
summary: If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. Health fraud scams promise help, treatments or cures but haven't been proven effective. Learn how to protect yourself.
alternative_names: Health scams; Quackery

title: Health Insurance
summary: Health insurance helps protect you from high medical care costs. Read about different types of benefits and what is covered.

title: Health Literacy
summary: Health literacy is the degree to which individuals have the ability to find, understand, and use information and services to inform health-related decisions.

title: Health Occupations
summary: People with jobs in the medical field provide healthcare for millions of people. Find out about medical and healthcare careers.
alternative_names: Health careers; Health professions; Medical occupations; Medical professions

title: Health Problems in Pregnancy
summary: Learn about illnesses and conditions that can make a pregnancy risky such as cancer and gestational diabetes. Get the facts on specific conditions and complications.

title: Health Risks of an Inactive Lifestyle
summary: An inactive lifestyle, with too much sitting and not enough exercise, is bad for you. Learn about the health risks and how you can be more active.
alternative_names: Sedentary Lifestyle; Sitting Disease

title: Health Screening
summary: Screenings are tests that look for diseases before you have symptoms. Learn about conditions you can be common health screening tests.
alternative_names: Screening tests

title: Health Statistics
summary: Health statistics are numbers about some aspect of health. Researchers use statistics to see patterns of diseases in groups of people. Learn more.

title: Healthy Aging
summary: As you get older, risk of chronic diseases increases. A healthy lifestyle and chronic condition management can help you live more independently later in life.

title: Healthy Living
summary: What does it take to lead a healthy life? Taking steps toward healthy living can help reduce your risk of heart disease, cancer, and other diseases.

title: Healthy Sleep
summary: Sleep is critical to your health and well-being. Learn about why you need sleep, how much you need, and how you can get better sleep.
alternative_names: Sleep Hygeine

title: Hearing Aids
summary: There are different types of hearing aids. They differ by size, placement, and how much they amplify sound. Discover which will work best for you.

title: Hearing Disorders and Deafness
summary: Hearing loss can be caused by trauma, diseases, long term exposure to loud noise and other factors. Learn about the two types of hearing loss.
alternative_names: Hearing loss; Presbycusis

title: Hearing Problems in Children
summary: Hearing problems can be temporary or permanent. About 2 or 3 out of every 1,000 children in the U.S. are born deaf or hard-of-hearing.

title: Heart Attack
summary: Over a million people in the U.S. have a heart attack each year. Learn the symptoms and get help quickly to prevent permanent heart damage and death.
alternative_names: MI; Myocardial infarction

title: Heart Disease in Women
summary: Heart disease is the leading cause of death for women in the US and affects people of all ages. A healthy lifestyle can help lower your risk of heart disease.

title: Heart Diseases
summary: Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the U.S. Learn about the different types of heart diseases, and what you can do to try to prevent them.
alternative_names: Cardiac diseases

title: Heart Failure
summary: Heart failure, or congestive heart failure (CHF), means the heart can't pump enough blood. Learn about the signs, symptoms and causes.
alternative_names: CHF; Cardiac failure; Congestive heart failure; Left-sided heart failure; Right-sided heart failure

title: Heart Health Tests
summary: Heart health tests, as part of a screening, or when you have, symptoms can help find heart diseases. Learn about imaging, stress, and other cardiac tests.
alternative_names: Cardiac Diagnostic Tests

title: Heart Surgery
summary: Heart surgery is used to fix certain problems with the heart. Learn about the different procedures and why someone might need them.
alternative_names: Cardiac surgery

title: Heart Transplantation
summary: A heart transplant removes a damaged or diseased heart and replaces it with a healthy one. Read about the surgery, risks, and living with a transplant.

title: Heart Valve Diseases
summary: Heart valve disease happens when one or more of your heart valves do not open or close correctly. This can affect your blood flow and strain your heart.
alternative_names: Valvular heart disease

title: Heartburn
summary: Looking for heartburn remedies?  Find out more about heartburn (pyrosis) and how to relieve this type of indigestion.
alternative_names: Acid indigestion; Pyrosis

title: Heat Illness
summary: During hot weather, especially with high humidity, sweating isn't enough and your temperature can rise and cause heat illnesses like heat exhaustion.
alternative_names: Heat exhaustion; Heat stroke; Sunstroke

title: Heel Injuries and Disorders
summary: Heel problems are common and painful. What causes heel pain? Read more about causes and conditions that can result from heel problems.

title: Helicobacter Pylori Infections
summary: H. Pylori is a bacterium that can infect the stomach. Being infected is associated with an increased risk of developing peptic ulcers. Learn more.

title: Hemochromatosis
summary: Hemochromatosis is an iron overload disease (too much iron in the body). The extra iron can build up in organs and cause damage. Find out how.
alternative_names: Iron overload disease

title: Hemophilia
summary: Hemophilia is a rare disorder in which the blood does not clot normally. Usually hemophilia usually occurs in males and is inherited. Learn more.
alternative_names: Christmas disease; Factor IX deficiency; Factor VIII deficiency

title: Hemorrhagic Fevers
summary: Viral hemorrhagic fevers are a group of illnesses caused by four families of viruses including Ebola and Marburg, Lassa fever, and yellow fever.
alternative_names: VHFs

title: Hemorrhagic Stroke
summary: Hemorrhagic stroke happens when a blood vessel breaks and bleeds into the brain. Learn about the symptoms and genetics behind hemorrhagic stroke.
alternative_names: Intracerebral Hemorrhage; Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

title: Hemorrhoids
summary: Hemorrhoids (piles) are swollen veins that sometimes protrude from the anus. Read these tips to find relief from uncomfortable symptoms.
alternative_names: Piles

title: Hepatitis
summary: The word "hepatitis" means inflammation of the liver. There are five main hepatitis viruses (A, B, C, D or E). Learn about the different types here.
alternative_names: Viral hepatitis

title: Hepatitis A
summary: Hepatitis A virus can infect people who accidentally ingest fecal matter in contaminated food or water or through personal contact. More on HAV here.
alternative_names: HAV

title: Hepatitis B
summary: Hepatitis B virus is a contagious liver infection spread from person-to-person via blood or body fluids. Who is at risk for HBV? Read about it here.
alternative_names: HBV

title: Hepatitis C
summary: Hepatitis C (HCV) is virus that causes liver inflammation. It usually spreads through contact with blood from someone who has HCV. It can be acute or chronic.
alternative_names: HCV

title: Herbal Medicine
summary: Herbal medicines are one type of dietary supplement. They are sold as tablets, capsules, powders, teas, extracts, and plants. Learn more.
alternative_names: Botanicals; Phytotherapy

title: Hernia
summary: Hernias can happen to anyone. They're caused by a combination of muscle weakness and strain. Learn about several types and therapies available.
alternative_names: Enterocele

title: Herniated Disk
summary: A herniated or slipped disc means that one of the soft cushions or discs between your vertebrae or spinal bones pushes out. Find out about it here.
alternative_names: Bulging disk; Compressed disk; Herniated intervertebral disk; Herniated nucleus pulposus; Prolapsed disk; Ruptured disk; Slipped disk

title: Heroin
summary: Heroin is a highly addictive drug made from morphine. It can be injected, snorted, or smoked. Learn about withdrawal symptoms and addiction treatment.
alternative_names: Big H; Black tar; H; Horse; Junk; Smack; TNT; Thunder

title: Herpes Simplex
summary: Learn about herpes simplex, a contagious infection caused by herpes simplex virus (HSV). Oral herpes affects the mouth. Genital herpes affects the genitals.
alternative_names: HSV

title: Hiatal Hernia
summary: A hiatal hernia is a result of the upper part of the stomach pushing through the diaphragm into the chest area. Read about symptoms and treatment.

title: Hiccups
summary: What exactly is a hiccup and how do you stop hiccupping once you start? Find out what triggers hiccups and when you should contact your doctor.
alternative_names: Hiccough

title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa
summary: Hidradenitis suppurativa (HS), or acne inversa, is a chronic skin disease. It causes painful bumps in your armpits and groin. Learn about treatment.
alternative_names: Acne inversa; Suppurative hidradenitis

title: High Blood Pressure
summary: High blood pressure (hypertension) develops when blood flows through arteries at higher than normal pressures. It increases the risk for heart disease and stroke.
alternative_names: Benign essential hypertension; Essential hypertension; HBP; HTN; Hypertension

title: High Blood Pressure in Pregnancy
summary: High blood pressure in pregnancy can include gestational hypertension, chronic hypertension, and preeclampsia. It can cause problems for both mother and baby.

title: High Cholesterol in Children and Teens
summary: High cholesterol isn’t just a problem for adults. It can put your child or teen at risk of coronary artery disease and other heart diseases. Learn more.

title: Hip Injuries and Disorders
summary: Take a look at some common and not so common hip injuries and disorders. Find tests and details on different problems of the hip and clinical trials.

title: Hip Replacement
summary: Hip arthroplasty (or hip replacement surgery) involves replacing a damaged hip joint with an artificial one to reduce pain and improve mobility.
alternative_names: Hip arthroplasty; Hip prosthesis

title: Histoplasmosis
summary: Histoplasmosis is a disease caused by a fungus (or mold) called Histoplasma. Learn about symptoms and treatment.

title: HIV
summary: HIV (human immunodeficiency virus) attacks the body’s immune system. There is no cure but it can be treated with medicines. To know if you have HIV, get tested.
alternative_names: AIDS; Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome; Human immunodeficiency virus

title: HIV and Infections
summary: Having HIV weakens your body's immune system. This can lead to serious infections that are called opportunistic infections (OIs). Read more.
alternative_names: AIDS-related opportunistic infections; OIs

title: HIV and Pregnancy
summary: HIV positive and pregnant or thinking about HIV and pregnancy? Learn how with early testing and medication you can significantly lower your risk of passing HIV to your baby.

title: HIV in Women
summary: Women who have HIV are at higher risk of certain infections, cancers, and diseases. There is no cure but there are treatments and medicines to prevent HIV.

title: HIV Medicines
summary: There are several different types of HIV medicines. They do not cure HIV, but fight the infection. Learn more about these medicines.
alternative_names: Antiretroviral therapy

title: HIV: PrEP and PEP
summary: PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis) and PEP (post-exposure prophylaxis) are medicines to prevent HIV. They are prescribed before or after there is exposure to HIV.
alternative_names: Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis and Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

title: Hives
summary: Hives is a skin rash that can cause the skin to be red and have itchy bumps. Learn possible reasons to have rashes and treatments.
alternative_names: Urticaria

title: Hodgkin Lymphoma
summary: Hodgkin lymphoma is a type of lymphoma, cancer of the lymph system. It is serious but can usually be cured if found and treated early. Learn more.
alternative_names: Hodgkin Disease

title: Home Care Services
summary: Home care is care that allows a person with special needs stay in their home. Learn about related issues and specifics.
alternative_names: In-home care

title: Homelessness and Health
summary: Homelessness and health are closely connected. Limited access to healthcare can contribute to the problem. Learn about news and specific resources.

title: Hormone Replacement Therapy
summary: Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) can relieve menopause symptoms. Risks include breast cancer and stroke. Certain types of HRT have a higher risk.
alternative_names: ERT; Estrogen replacement therapy; HRT; Menopausal hormone therapy

title: Hormones
summary: Hormones are your body's chemical messengers. They affect many processes including mood. Too much or too little of a certain hormone can be serious.

title: Hospice Care
summary: Hospice care is end-of-life care. Medical professionals and volunteers give medical, psychological, and spiritual support. Read more.
alternative_names: End-of-life care

title: Household Products
summary: Household products for cleaning and other uses can contain ingredients that can harm your family and the environment. Learn more.

title: How Much Exercise Do I Need?
summary: You know that exercise is good for your health, but how much do you need? Learn what's recommended, along with which types of exercise you need.

title: How to Improve Mental Health
summary: Your mental health affects all parts of your life. Learn how to improve your mental health, through positive thinking, relaxation techniques, and gratitude.
alternative_names: Boost Emotional Wellness; Improve Emotional Health; Stay Positive

title: How to Lower Cholesterol
summary: High cholesterol raises your risk of heart diseases. Treatments to lower cholesterol include lifestyle changes like diet and exercise, and medicines if needed.

title: How to Lower Cholesterol with Diet
summary: One important way to lower your cholesterol is through diet. Learn which foods to avoid, which ones you should limit, and what you can eat instead.
alternative_names: Low Cholesterol Diet; TLC Diet; Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes Diet

title: How to Prevent Diabetes
summary: Many Americans are at risk for type 2 diabetes. Healthy eating, regular exercise, and weight control may help prevent or delay getting diabetes.

title: How to Prevent Heart Disease
summary: Heart disease is the leading cause of the death in the U.S, and is a major cause of disability. There are many heart disease risk factors that you can change.

title: How to Prevent High Blood Pressure
summary: Many people have high blood pressure, or are at risk for it. Learn how you may be able to prevent or treat it, with simple, healthy lifestyle changes.
alternative_names: Lowering High Blood Pressure

title: HPV
summary: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) is a common sexually transmitted infection. A pap smear can help detect changes in the cervix caused by HPV. Learn more.
alternative_names: Human papillomavirus

title: Huntington's Disease
summary: Huntington's disease (HD) is an inherited disease that causes nerve cells in the brain to waste away. It causes disability that gets worse over time.
alternative_names: HD; Huntington's chorea

title: Hurricanes
summary: Hurricanes are severe tropical storms that produce heavy rains and wind that can exceed 155 miles per hour. Read more about the effects of them.
alternative_names: Cyclones; Typhoons

title: Hydrocephalus
summary: Hydrocephalus is the buildup of too much cerebrospinal fluid in the brain. It can be present at birth, or happen later. Read about causes, treatment.
alternative_names: Water on the brain

title: Hyperglycemia
summary: Hyperglycemia means high blood sugar or glucose. Hyperglycemia happens when your body doesn't make enough insulin or can't use it the right way.
alternative_names: High blood glucose; High blood sugar

title: Hyperthyroidism
summary: Thyroid hormones control the rate of many activities in your body. Hyperthyroidism means the thyroid makes more thyroid hormones than the body needs.
alternative_names: Overactive thyroid

title: Hypoglycemia
summary: Read about the causes and symptoms related to hypoglycemia, a condition that generally affects people with low blood sugar levels.
alternative_names: Low blood sugar

title: Hypothermia
summary: People with hypothermia suffer from low body temperature, which is usually below 95 degrees. Read about the common ways to get hypothermia.
alternative_names: Cold-related illness

title: Hypothyroidism
summary: Hypothyroidism happens when your thyroid gland does not make enough thyroid hormone to meet your body's needs. Hypothyroidism is more common in women.
alternative_names: Underactive thyroid

title: Hysterectomy
summary: A hysterectomy is a surgery to remove a woman's uterus. There are different types of hysterectomy surgeries. Learn why they are used as treatments.

title: Immune System and Disorders
summary: Your immune system is made up of cells, tissues, and organs that fight infections and diseases. Learn how it works, and about diseases of the immune system.

title: Impaired Driving
summary: Impaired driving affects everyone. Some of the causes include sleepiness, drugs and alcohol. Learn how to ensure safety on the road.
alternative_names: Distracted driving; Drugged driving; Drunk driving

title: Impetigo
summary: Impetigo is a skin infection caused by staph or strep bacterias. It can spread by contact with an infected person. Treated with antibiotics.

title: Indigestion
summary: If you've ever overindulged in a favorite dish, you've probably experienced indigestion (dyspepsia). Read about causes and therapies here.
alternative_names: Dyspepsia; Upset stomach

title: Indoor Air Pollution
summary: Indoor air pollution has the same negative effects as environmental pollution. Sources include mold, pesticides and more. Find out how you can reduce it.

title: Infant and Newborn Care
summary: Going home with a new baby is exciting but it can be scary too. Read about the changes a newborn goes through and also see tips for proper baby care.
alternative_names: Baby care

title: Infant and Newborn Development
summary: Babies do not develop at the same rate. However, there are 5 growth areas that are crucial to infant and newborn development. Read about them.

title: Infant and Newborn Nutrition
summary: From breastfeeding to solid foods, infant and newborn nutrition provides babies with nutrients needed to grow. Read about how to identify allergies.

title: Infection Control
summary: Every year, lives are lost because of the spread of hospital infections. Read about the preventive steps you can take, such as proper handwashing

title: Infections and Pregnancy
summary: If you're pregnant and get an infection, it could be dangerous for you and your baby. Learn tips to avoid getting infections and treatment options.

title: Infectious Arthritis
summary: Infectious or septic arthritis is a bacterial infection of the joint. Learn why people get infectious arthritis, tests needed and how it is treated.
alternative_names: Septic arthritis

title: Infectious Diseases
summary: Infectious diseases are caused by four main kinds of germs. Vaccines, proper hand washing and medicines can help prevent infections. Discover more.
alternative_names: Communicable diseases

title: Infectious Mononucleosis
summary: Infectious mononucleosis (mono), or "the kissing disease," is a viral infection. It is often caused by the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), which can spread in saliva.
alternative_names: Glandular fever; Kissing disease; Mono; Mononucleosis

title: Infertility
summary: Infertility is when a woman can't get pregnant after a year or keeps having miscarriages. Read about infertility, its causes, and treatments.
alternative_names: Sterility

title: Inhalants
summary: Inhalants are substances that people, usually teens, inhale (breathe in) to get high. Inhalants that are misused include cleaners, gases, and aerosols.
alternative_names: Huffing

title: Inhalation Injuries
summary: There are a variety of substances you can inhale that can cause internal injuries, such as smoke and toxic fumes. Discover the symptoms and treatment.

title: Insect Bites and Stings
summary: You swat a bug off, but now you have an itchy bump. Was it a mosquito, a flea, a tick? Learn how to prevent, identify, and treat bug bites and stings.
alternative_names: Bug bites

title: Interstitial Cystitis
summary: Do you suffer from discomfort or pain in the bladder? If yes, you may be dealing with Interstitial cystitis (IC). Read more about it
alternative_names: Bladder pain syndrome; IC; PBS; Painful bladder syndrome

title: Interstitial Lung Diseases
summary: Interstitial lung diseases are a group of diseases that inflame or scar the lungs. Breathing in particles (asbestosis, silicosis) causes some types.

title: Intestinal Cancer
summary: There are five types of small intestine cancer. Find out how your diet and health history can affect your risk. Learn about intestinal cancer here.
alternative_names: Duodenal cancer; Ileal cancer; Jejunal cancer; Small intestine cancer

title: Intestinal Obstruction
summary: Intestinal or bowel obstructions can have many causes. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis, and tests.
alternative_names: Bowel obstruction; Intestinal volvulus; Paralytic ileus

title: Intimate Partner Violence
summary: Intimate partner violence (IPV) is abuse that happens in a romantic relationship. It is also called domestic violence. Learn the signs and how to get help.
alternative_names: Battery; Domestic violence; Partner abuse; Spousal abuse

title: Iron
summary: Our bodies need the right amount of iron to function properly. Read about what can happen when you consume too much or too little of it.

title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
summary: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) can cause a great deal of discomfort. Learn about the symptoms, causes, and treatments of IBS.
alternative_names: IBS; Irritable colon

title: Ischemic Stroke
summary: A stroke is a medical emergency that should be treated immediately. Read about the causes, symptoms and treatments for an ischemic stroke.
alternative_names: Embolic Stroke; Thrombotic stroke

title: Islet Cell Transplantation
summary: Islets in the pancreas contain beta cells that produce insulin. Islet transplantation is an experimental treatment for type 1 diabetes.

title: Itching
summary: Pruritis or itchy skin is tingling or irritation that makes you want to scratch the area. It's a symptom of many health conditions. Learn the causes.
alternative_names: Pruritus

title: Jaundice
summary: Jaundice is a yellow coloring of the skin or eyes caused by too much bilirubin in the body. Jaundice can happen for many reasons. Learn about it here.
alternative_names: Icterus

title: Jaw Injuries and Disorders
summary: The types of jaw injuries and disorders that can cause problems are dislocations, fractures, misaligned teeth, and more. Learn about them here.

title: Joint Disorders
summary: Joint disorders are caused by diseases and injuries. Treatments and therapies depend on the cause and range from pain relievers to surgery.

title: Juvenile Arthritis
summary: Juvenile arthritis or JA, causes joint swelling, pain, stiffness and loss of motion in children. Learn diagnosis and tests for JA.
alternative_names: Childhood arthritis; JRA; Juvenile idiopathic arthritis; Still's disease

title: Kaposi Sarcoma
summary: Kaposi sarcoma or KS is a cancer that causes red or purple patches of abnormal tissue to grow under the skin. Can spread to organs and cause bleeding.
alternative_names: KS

title: Kawasaki Disease
summary: Kawasaki disease is a rare childhood disease that makes the walls of the blood vessels in the body become inflamed. Learn what symptoms to look for.
alternative_names: Mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome

title: Kidney Cancer
summary: Kidney cancer symptoms are hard to detect at first but they do exist. Read more about the top 5 symptoms and the treatment options available
alternative_names: Hypernephroma; Renal cancer

title: Kidney Cysts
summary: Polycystic kidney disease (PKD) are kidney cysts that enlarge kidneys and make them work poorly, leading to kidney failure. Learn about PKD symptoms

title: Kidney Diseases
summary: Properly functioning kidneys are critical for maintaining good health. Diabetes, high blood pressure, or family history can increase risk of kidney disease.
alternative_names: Renal disease

title: Kidney Failure
summary: Healthy kidneys clean your blood by removing excess from your body. But if kidneys are damaged, they won't work properly. Read about the treatments.
alternative_names: ESRD; End-stage renal disease; Renal failure

title: Kidney Stones
summary: Kidney stones (or nephrolithiasis) symptoms include vomiting, blood in your urine and more. Find a full list of symptoms and treatments available
alternative_names: Nephrolithiasis

title: Kidney Tests
summary: Your kidneys filter and clean your blood. Read about the blood, urine, and imaging tests that doctors use to diagnose and monitor kidney diseases.
alternative_names: Kidney Function Panel; Kidney Function Tests; Kidney Panel; Renal Function Panel

title: Kidney Transplantation
summary: Read more about the process and details of a kidney transplantation and how they may affect your body.
alternative_names: Renal transplantation

title: Klinefelter Syndrome
summary: Klinefelter syndrome (KS) is a condition that occurs in men who have an extra X chromosome. Read about the common symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: XXY male

title: Knee Injuries and Disorders
summary: Knee injuries and knee disorders can cause pain, swelling and stiffness. Knee problems can be affected by rheumatic diseases and cartilage damage.

title: Knee Replacement
summary: Knee replacement surgery (or knee arthroplasty) provides artificial knees in place of your damaged knees to restore function and relieve pain.
alternative_names: Knee arthroplasty

title: Laboratory Tests
summary: Laboratory tests help doctors determine what is going on within your body. Many factors affect test results. Find a list of those factors.

title: Lactose Intolerance
summary: Lactose intolerance means that you cannot digest foods with lactose in them. Lactose is the sugar found in milk and foods made with milk. Read more.
alternative_names: Dairy product intolerance; Lactase deficiency; Milk intolerance

title: Laser Eye Surgery
summary: Laser eye surgery (LASIK) is surgery to improve your vision. You may no longer need glasses or contacts. Learn about the types and who can get it.
alternative_names: Keratectomy; LASIK; LTK; PRK

title: Latex Allergy
summary: A latex allergy causes rashes, asthma, or even anaphylaxis. Hundreds of everyday products contain latex. Learn what you need to know to avoid latex.

title: Latino and Hispanic American Health
summary: Genetics, environmental factors, access to healthcare, and cultural factors impact health. Learn about health issues that affect Latino and Hispanic Americans.

title: LDL: The "Bad" Cholesterol
summary: LDL, or low-density lipoprotein, is the "bad" cholesterol. A high LDL level can lead to a buildup of cholesterol in your arteries.
alternative_names: Low-density lipoprotein

title: Lead Poisoning
summary: Breathing air, drinking water or eating food that contains lead can cause health problems. Find a list of scenarios that can lead to lead poisoning.
alternative_names: Plumbism

title: Learning Disabilities
summary: Learning disabilities affect how people understand, remember and respond to information. Learn more on how to identify and cope with  learning disabilities.
alternative_names: Learning differences; Learning disorders

title: Leg Injuries and Disorders
summary: Leg injuries and leg disorders can affect the whole leg or just one part. Read about common leg injuries such as sprains, strains, and fractures.

title: Legionnaires' Disease
summary: Legionnaires' Disease (Legionella Pneumonia) is caused by bacteria. You get it by breathing in mist from water that contains the bacteria. Learn more.
alternative_names: Legionellosis

title: Leishmaniasis
summary: Leishmaniasis or leishmania, also known as Kala-azar is a parasitic disease spread by the bite of infected sand flies.
alternative_names: Kala-azar

title: Leukemia
summary: Leukemia is cancer of the white blood cells. There are two types of Leukemias, acute and chronic. Learn about the differences and treatments available.

title: Leukodystrophies
summary: Leukodystrophies are rare diseases that affect the cells of the brain and are often genetic. Find more information on these progressive diseases.

title: Lewy Body Dementia
summary: Lewy body dementia (LBD) is one common cause of dementia. In LBD, protein deposits build up in the brain. Read about the symptoms and what can help.
alternative_names: Dementia with Lewy bodies; LBD; Lewy body disease; Parkinson's disease dementia

title: LGBTQIA+ Health
summary: The LGBTQIA+ community can experience health disparities and discrimination. Learn about gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender health issues.

title: Limb Loss
summary: Limb loss and amputations have different causes including birth defects, cancer and injuries. Physical therapy and counseling may help with recovery.

title: Lipid Metabolism Disorders
summary: Lipids include fats, oils, and cholesterol. Disorders like Gaucher disease and Tay-Sachs cause problems with how your body uses lipids. Read more.

title: Listeria Infections
summary: Listeria infections are caused by bacteria found in raw and processed foods. Find a list of symptoms and treatments that can help reduce your risk.
alternative_names: Listeriosis

title: Liver Cancer
summary: The most common form of liver cancer in adults is hepatocellular carcinoma. Learn about diagnosis, treatment and taking part in research studies.
alternative_names: Hepatocellular carcinoma

title: Liver Diseases
summary: Get the facts about liver diseases, such as hepatitis, cancer, and cirrhosis. Know your risk and what you can do to prevent liver problems.
alternative_names: Hepatic disease

title: Liver Transplantation
summary: Understand the facts about liver transplantation. Read about risks, outlook and the process for getting a liver transplant.
alternative_names: Hepatic transplantation

title: Living with HIV
summary: Infection with HIV is serious, but the outlook is improving. Discover the many things you can do to help ensure you have a longer, healthier life.

title: Low Blood Pressure
summary: Some people have low blood pressure (hypotension). It is only a problem if it causes dizziness, fainting, or shock. Learn about what can cause it.
alternative_names: Hypotension; LBP

title: Lung Cancer
summary: Lung cancer forms in tissues of the lung, usually in the cells that line the air passages. It is the leading cause of cancer death in both men and women.
alternative_names: Bronchogenic carcinoma

title: Lung Diseases
summary: Lung diseases are disorders or infections that affect the lungs and cause breathing problems. Some can lead to respiratory failure. Find out more about prevention, living with lung diseases, and treatment.

title: Lung Transplantation
summary: A lung transplant removes a diseased lung and replaces it with a healthy one. Discover what to expect before, after, and during a lung transplant.

title: Lupus
summary: Lupus is an autoimmune disease that causes your immune system to attack your healthy tissues and cells. This can cause damage to many parts of your body.
alternative_names: Discoid lupus; SLE; Subacute cutaneous lupus; Systemic lupus erythematosus

title: Lyme Disease
summary: Lyme disease is an infection you get from tick bites. The first symptom is usually a rash. Learn about Lyme disease symptoms and treatment.

title: Lymphatic Diseases
summary: Lymphatic diseases can affect your lymph, lymph vessels, or lymph nodes. Lymphatic system problems include lymphedema and swollen glands. Learn more.

title: Lymphedema
summary: Lymphedema is the name of a type of swelling that happens when lymph builds up in your body's soft tissue. Discover causes and treatment options.
alternative_names: Lymphatic obstruction

title: Lymphoma
summary: Lymphoma is a cancer affecting the immune system. Hodgkins Lymphoma and Non Hodgkins Lymphoma are types of lymphoma. Learn about symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: Non-Hodgkin lymphoma

title: Macular Degeneration
summary: Macular degeneration, or age-related macular degeneration (AMD), causes vision loss in older adults. Learn about the types and what can help.
alternative_names: AMD; Age-related macular degeneration

title: Malabsorption Syndromes
summary: If you have a malabsorption syndrome, your small intestine cannot absorb nutrients from foods. Learn more about different syndromes and symptoms.

title: Malaria
summary: Malaria is a disease caused by a parasite transmitted by mosquitoes. It is a major cause of death worldwide. Find out about prevention and treatment.

title: Male Breast Cancer
summary: Did you know that men can get breast cancer? Although breast cancer is much more common in women, men can get it too. Learn more.

title: Male Infertility
summary: Infertility is when a woman can't get pregnant after a year or keeps having miscarriages. Read about the causes of male infertility and treatments.

title: Malnutrition
summary: People suffer from hunger if they don't get enough food. Over time this can cause malnutrition. Some diseases can also cause malnutrition. Read more.

title: Mammography
summary: A mammography exam (mammogram) is an x-ray of the breast and is used to detect breast diseases like cancer. Find out how it works and what to expect.

title: Managed Care
summary: Managed care plans are a type of health insurance. Plans that restrict your choices usually cost less. Flexible plans may cost more. Learn more.

title: Marfan Syndrome
summary: Marfan syndrome is a disorder that affects connective tissue. Marfan syndrome can be mild to severe. Read about symptoms and outlook.

title: Marijuana
summary: Marijuana contains the mind-altering chemical THC. Some U.S. states approve the use of medical marijuana. Read about marijuana and its effects.
alternative_names: Cannabis; Ganja; Grass; Hash; Pot; Weed

title: Mastectomy
summary: A mastectomy is a surgery to remove a breast or part of a breast in order to treat breast cancer. A lumpectomy is done to remove a tumor. Read more.

title: Measles
summary: Measles or rubeola is an infectious disease caused by a virus. It spreads easily person to person, causes red blotchy rash along with other symptoms.
alternative_names: Rubeola

title: Medicaid
summary: Medicaid is government health insurance that helps low-income people in the U.S. pay their medical bills. Learn about services and eligibility.

title: Medical Device Safety
summary: Medical devices can diagnose, cure, treat, or prevent some diseases. It is important to know how to use medical devices safely. Read more.

title: Medical Ethics
summary: Most areas of healthcare have an ethical aspect. Learn about ethical issues in healthcare and bioethics.

title: Medicare
summary: Medicare is the U.S. government's health insurance program for people age 65 and older. Medicare has four parts (A, B, C, and D). Read more.

title: Medication Errors
summary: Medicines cure infection, prevent problems, and ease pain. Medicines can also cause harm if not used correctly. Learn about medication errors.

title: Medicines
summary: You may take medicines every day or only once in a while. Either way, make sure your medicines are safe and will help you get better. Learn more.
alternative_names: Drugs; Medications

title: Medicines and Children
summary: Never guess how to give medicines to a child. When it comes to taking medicines, kids aren't just small adults. Learn how to follow the drug label.

title: Melanoma
summary: Melanoma is the most serious type of skin cancer. Most have a black or black-blue area. Learn the 'ABCDE' of what to watch for and treatment options.

title: Memory
summary: Did you forget where you put your keys? It's normal to forget things, but it can be a sign of memory problems. Read more on memory and memory loss.

title: Men's Health
summary: Many men need to pay more attention to their health. Preventive care and screening tests can help lower risks, detect problems early, and improve outcomes.

title: Meniere's Disease
summary: Meniere's disease is a disorder of the inner ear. Symptoms include severe dizziness, tinnitus, hearing loss, and ear pressure or pain. Learn more.

title: Meningitis
summary: Meningitis or spinal meningitis is inflammation of the tissue around the brain and spinal cord. Discover the differences between types of meningitis.
alternative_names: Spinal meningitis

title: Meningococcal Disease
summary: Meningococcal disease is the name for illness caused by meningococcal bacteria. The illnesses are often severe, but vaccines can help prevent them. Learn more.
alternative_names: Meningococcal Infections

title: Menopause
summary: Menopause is when a woman stops having a period. The transition to menopause usually starts in your 40's. Know the symptoms and how to deal with them.
alternative_names: Change of life

title: Menstruation
summary: Menstruation (or period) happens monthly. As the uterus sheds its lining, vaginal bleeding follows. Menstrual blood is made of blood and tissue.
alternative_names: Menses; Menstrual period; Period

title: Mental Disorders
summary: Mental disorders (also called mental illness) include a wide range of problems. There are many causes. Learn more about what can help.
alternative_names: Mental illness

title: Mental Health
summary: Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act. Your mental health can change over time.

title: Mercury
summary: It is important to protect your family from mercury exposure. Learn about mercury and how to limit exposure.

title: Mesothelioma
summary: Mesothelioma is a tumor of mesothelium, a tissue that lines lungs and other organs. Most people who get it have inhaled asbestos. Read the symptoms.
alternative_names: Malignant mesothelioma

title: Metabolic Disorders
summary: Your metabolism makes energy from the food you eat. A metabolic disorder disrupts this process. One example is diabetes. Learn more.

title: Metabolic Syndrome
summary: Metabolic syndrome (also called insulin resistance syndrome) is a group of conditions that put you at risk for heart disease and diabetes. Read more.
alternative_names: Insulin resistance syndrome; Metabolic syndrome X

title: Methamphetamine
summary: Methamphetamine (also known as meth or crystal meth) is a very addictive drug. Read about the signs of meth addiction and health problems it causes.
alternative_names: Chalk; Crystal; Glass; Ice; Meth; Speed; Tina

title: Migraine
summary: Migraines are pulsing or throbbing headaches in one area of the head. Learn about other symptoms, what triggers migraines, and how to treat them.

title: Mild Cognitive Impairment
summary: In mild cognitive impairment (MCI), you have more memory and thinking problems than others your age, but they don't interfere with your everyday life.
alternative_names: MCI

title: Minerals
summary: Your body uses minerals to build bones, make hormones, and regulate your heartbeat. Read about the types of minerals and how to get them.

title: Miscarriage
