summary: A miscarriage is the loss of a pregnancy during the first 13 weeks of pregnancy. Read about symptoms and how to cope if you've suffered a miscarriage.
alternative_names: Spontaneous abortion

title: Mitochondrial Diseases
summary: Mitochondria make energy for your cells. Diseases can affect mitochondria, often causing nerve and muscle problems. Find out more.

title: Mitral Valve Prolapse
summary: Mitral valve prolapse (MVP) occurs when one of your heart's valves doesn't work properly. Problems are rare. Learn about symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: Barlow's syndrome; Floppy valve syndrome; MVP

title: Mobility Aids
summary: Mobility aids help you walk or move if you are disabled or have an injury. Choosing these devices takes time and research. Learn more.
alternative_names: Ambulation devices

title: Molds
summary: If you have wet spots in your house, you will probably get mold. Molds, such as black mold, can cause health problems. Read more.
alternative_names: Fungi

title: Moles
summary: Moles are skin growths, most people have them. Nevus is an unusual mole or a birthmark. Have them checked if they should change in size or color.
alternative_names: Nevus

title: Mood Disorders
summary: Most people feel sad or irritable sometimes. They may say they're in a bad mood. But mood disorders affect your everyday emotional state. Learn more.

title: Mosquito Bites
summary: Mosquitoes can be more than just annoying; sometimes they spread diseases. Learn about the diseases and how to protect yourself from mosquito bites.

title: Motion Sickness
summary: Motion sickness can start suddenly, with a queasy feeling and cold sweats. Read about how you can prevent motion sickness while traveling.
alternative_names: Airsickness; Carsickness; Seasickness

title: Motor Vehicle Safety
summary: Every year thousands of people in the U.S. die from car crashes. Read about how to be safe on the road.
alternative_names: Automobile safety; Car safety; Vehicle safety

title: Mouth Disorders
summary: Common mouth problems include cold sores, canker sores, thrush, dry mouth, and bad breath. Discover information on all of these common disorders.

title: Movement Disorders
summary: Movement disorders can be caused by nerve diseases, autoimmune diseases, infections and more. Many movement disorders are inherited.

title: Mpox
summary: Mpox (monkeypox) is a rare disease caused by infection with the mpox virus. Learn about the symptoms and how it spreads, and vaccinations.
alternative_names: Monkeypox

title: MRI Scans
summary: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) uses a large magnet and radio waves to look at organs and structures inside the body. Read about the use of MRI scan.
alternative_names: Magnetic resonance imaging; NMR; Nuclear magnetic resonance

title: MRSA
summary: MRSA infection is a staph infection that is resistant to some antibiotics. Read about MRSA symptoms, treatment, and prevention.
alternative_names: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus

title: Multiple Myeloma
summary: Multiple myeloma is a cancer that begins in plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. Discover symptoms, diagnostic tests, and treatments for myeloma.
alternative_names: Plasma-cell myeloma

title: Multiple Sclerosis
summary: Multiple sclerosis (MS) slows down or blocks messages between the brain and body. MS can be mild or severe. Learn about MS symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: MS

title: Mumps
summary: Mumps symptoms include fever, headache, and muscle aches. There is no treatment, but the MMR vaccine can prevent it. Get the facts about the vaccine.

title: Muscle Cramps
summary: Have you ever had sudden, painful cramps in a muscle? These muscle spasms (also called charley horse) are very common. Learn how to relieve the pain.
alternative_names: Charley horse

title: Muscle Disorders
summary: Your muscles help you move and help your body work. Muscle disorders can cause weakness, pain or even paralysis. Read more about muscle disorders.
alternative_names: Myopathy

title: Muscular Dystrophy
summary: Muscular dystrophy (MD) is characterized by progressive weakness and muscle damage. Read about who it affects and the prognosis.
alternative_names: MD

title: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
summary: Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) is a long-term illness. It causes severe fatigue and many other symptoms. Learn about managing them.
alternative_names: CFS; Chronic fatigue syndrome; ME/CFS; Myalgic encephalomyelitis; SEID; Systemic exertion intolerance disease

title: Myasthenia Gravis
summary: Myasthenia gravis (MG) is an autoimmune disease that weakens the muscles under your control.  Find out about MG causes, symptoms, and treatment.

title: Mycobacterial Infections
summary: Mycobacteria are a type of germ. There are many different kinds. Read about the types of mycobacteria and the symptoms of infection.

title: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
summary: Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) are rare. They are sometimes found during a routine blood test. Learn symptoms, risk factors, and treatment options.
alternative_names: MDS

title: Myositis
summary: Myositis means inflammation of the muscles. Two specific types are polymyositis and dermatomyositis. Read about myositis symptoms and management.

title: Nail Diseases
summary: The health of your fingernails and toenails can be a clue to your overall health. Read about diseases that can affect your nails and about nail care.

title: Nasal Cancer
summary: Cancer of the nasal cavity and paranasal sinuses is rare, but you are at a greater risk if you are a smoker. Learn other factors increase your risk.
alternative_names: Cancer of the nasal cavity; Cancer of the paranasal sinus

title: Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander Health
summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. On this page, you'll find links to issues that affect Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders.

title: Nausea and Vomiting
summary: You call it barfing, puking, or throwing up; your doctor calls it vomiting. Read more about nausea and vomiting and the conditions that cause them.
alternative_names: Emesis

title: Neck Injuries and Disorders
summary: Neck pain is very common and can happen for many reasons, such as overuse, muscle strain, or whiplash. Learn how to relieve neck pain.

title: Neural Tube Defects
summary: Neural tube defects are birth defects of the brain, spine, or spinal cord. They happen in the first month of pregnancy. Learn how to prevent them.

title: Neuroblastoma
summary: Neuroblastoma is a cancer in nerve tissue in the adrenal gland, neck, chest, or spinal cord. It often affects young children. Read about treatments.

title: Neurofibromatosis
summary: Neurofibromatosis (NF) is a genetic disorder that causes tumors to grow on nerves. Learn about the types, their symptoms, and how they are treated.
alternative_names: Recklinghausen's disease; von Recklinghausen's disease

title: Neurologic Diseases
summary: Your nervous system includes your brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Learn about neurologic diseases, including their symptoms, causes, and treatments.
alternative_names: Nervous system diseases

title: Neuromuscular Disorders
summary: Neuromuscular disorders affect the nerves that control your voluntary muscles. Many are genetic. Read about different disorders and treatments.

title: Newborn Screening
summary: Your newborn infant has screening tests before leaving the hospital. Get the facts about these tests and what you should expect.

title: Noise
summary: Sounds that are too loud can damage sensitive structures of the inner ear and cause noise-induced hearing loss. Learn how to protect your hearing.

title: Non-Drug Pain Management
summary: There are risks to taking pain medicines, especially opioids. Learn about different techniques and treatments which may help you manage your pain without taking medicines.

title: Norovirus Infections
summary: Noroviruses are a group of related viruses that cause symptoms like nausea and diarrhea. Learn about the proper treatments for Norovirus Infections.
alternative_names: Norwalk virus infections

title: Nose Injuries and Disorders
summary: There are many problems that can affect the nose including a deviated septum, nasal polyps, nosebleeds, rhinitis, and nasal fractures. Learn more.
alternative_names: Nasal disorders

title: Nuclear Scans
summary: Nuclear scans use radioactive substances to see structures and functions inside your body. Read about how the test is used and what to expect.
alternative_names: Radioisotope scans; Radionuclide scans

title: Nursing Homes
summary: A nursing home is a place for people who don't need to be in a hospital but can't be cared for at home. Learn about choosing a nursing home.

title: Nutrition
summary: Food provides the energy and nutrients you need to be healthy. It is important to eat a variety of foods to get all the nutrients you need. Learn more.

title: Nutrition for Older Adults
summary: Studies show that a good diet in your later years reduces risk of osteoporosis, high blood pressure, heart diseases, and certain cancers. Read more.

title: Nutritional Support
summary: Nutritional support is therapy for people who do not get enough nourishment by eating or drinking. Read about the process of gaining nutrients.
alternative_names: Artificial feeding; Artificial hydration and nutrition; Hyperalimentation; Parenteral nutrition; TPN; Tube feeding

title: Obesity
summary: Read about the causes of obesity and find out what you can do to decrease your risk of its associated health issues.

title: Obesity in Children
summary: Obesity in children is hard to spot because they all grow at different rates. Find a list of tips that can help you monitor your child's health.

title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
summary: People with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) suffer from frequent, upsetting thoughts called obsessions. Read about the treatments available.
alternative_names: OCD

title: Occupational Health
summary: Occupational health problems vary from broken bones to vision problems. Take the following precautions to ensure safety on the job.

title: Occupational Health for Health Care Providers
summary: Healthcare workers are exposed to many hazards. Ensure that you have an occupational health plan for your healthcare providers with following tips.

title: Oil Spills
summary: Read about the environmental and economic effects of oil spills.

title: Older Adult Health
summary: Older adult health deals with changes as we age. Having a healthy lifestyle helps you deal with changes in your body and mind to make the most of life.

title: Older Adult Mental Health
summary: Older adult mental health includes emotional, psychological, and social well-being as we age. It affects how we think, feel, and act as we cope with life and aging. Learn more.
alternative_names: Senior mental health

title: Opioid Overdose
summary: Opioid overdose leads to slowing or stopping of breathing and sometimes death. You can take steps to help prevent an overdose, and respond to one with naloxone.

title: Opioid Use Disorder (OUD) Treatment
summary: Opioid use disorder (OUD) is a serious problem. Treatments include medications for opioid use disorder (MOUD) and counseling.
alternative_names: Medications for opioid use disorder (MOUD); Opioid abuse and addiction treatment

title: Opioids and Opioid Use Disorder (OUD)
summary: Opioid use disorder (OUD) a serious public health problem in the U.S. Learn about opioids, how they affect the body, and what OUD is.
alternative_names: Opioid abuse; Opioid addiction; Opioid misuse

title: Optic Nerve Disorders
summary: Your optic nerves carries visual images from the back of your eye to your brain. Learn about optic nerve disorders and how they affect your vision.

title: Oral Cancer
summary: Oral cancer can form in the mouth or throat but usually begins in the tongue and floor of the mouth. Read about the common oral cancer symptoms.

title: Organ Donation
summary: Experts say that the organs from one donor can save or help as many as 50 people. Read about the how to become an organ donor.

title: Organ Transplantation
summary: When you have an organ transplant, doctors remove an organ from another person and place it in your body. Read about the common organ transplants.

title: Orthodontia
summary: Orthodontia is the branch of dentistry that uses treatments such as braces, aligners, and retainers to straighten your teeth and correct your bite. Learn more.
alternative_names: Braces

title: Osteoarthritis
summary: Osteoarthritis is the most common form of arthritis. It usually affects your hands, knees, hips, or spine. Learn about treatment and management.
alternative_names: Degenerative joint disease; OA; Osteoarthrosis

title: Osteogenesis Imperfecta
summary: Osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) is a genetic disorder in which bones break easily. Find out diagnosis, treatments, and living with OI.
alternative_names: Brittle bone disease; OI

title: Osteonecrosis
summary: Osteonecrosis (Avascular Necrosis) is marked by a loss of blood supply to the bones, causing bone to break down faster than the body make new bone.
alternative_names: Aseptic necrosis; Avascular necrosis; Ischemic necrosis

title: Osteoporosis
summary: Osteoporosis is a disease that weakens your bones and makes them more likely to break or fracture. There are no symptoms until the first bone break.

title: Ostomy
summary: An ostomy treats certain diseases of the digestive or urinary systems. Learn about different types of ostomy including colostomy and ileostomy

title: Ovarian Cancer
summary: Ovarian cancer is hard to detect early because it may not cause early signs or symptoms.  It's important to recognize the signs and learn how to reduce your risk.

title: Ovarian Cysts
summary: An ovarian cyst is a fluid-filled sac in or on the ovary. Most women have them sometime in their lives. Cysts are rarely cancerous in women under 50.

title: Ovarian Disorders
summary: Ovarian disorders that affect women's health include cancer, cysts, polycystic ovary syndrome, and ovarian torsion. Learn more about ovarian health.

title: Over-the-Counter Medicines
summary: Over-the-counter medicines differ from prescription medicines but offer the same benefits. Find out how to use them properly.
alternative_names: Non-prescription drugs; OTC medicines

title: Overactive Bladder
summary: An overactive bladder (or polyuria) will cause you to urinate 8 or more times a day or 2 or more times a night. Read about the treatment available

title: Oxygen Therapy
summary: Oxygen therapy is a treatment that provides extra oxygen. A different kind of oxygen therapy is called hyperbaric oxygen therapy. Find out more.

title: Ozone
summary: Ozone is a gas that can be good or bad. Good ozone is 10-30 miles above Earth's surface while bad ozone is at ground level. Read more about both.

title: Pacemakers and Implantable Defibrillators
summary: Pacemakers and implantable defibrillators are devices that monitor and help control abnormal heart rhythms. Learn who needs one, and how they work.

title: Paget's Disease of Bone
summary: Paget's disease of bone causes your bones to grow too large and weak. It can cause pain and damage in the bones. Learn more.
alternative_names: Osteitis deformans

title: Pain
summary: Pain is a feeling triggered in the nervous system. You may feel it as a prick, tingle, sting, burn, or ache. Read about the causes and what can help.

title: Pain Relievers
summary: There are many pain relievers available. Read about over-the-counter vs. prescribed pain killers and how each might affect your health.
alternative_names: Analgesics; Pain killers; Pain medicines

title: Palliative Care
summary: If you have a serious illness, palliative care can treat your discomfort, pain, other symptoms, and stress. It can improve your quality of life. Learn more.

title: Pancreas Transplantation
summary: A pancreas transplant is surgery to place a healthy pancreas from a donor into a person with a diseased pancreas. Learn more.

title: Pancreatic Cancer
summary: The pancreas is a gland behind your stomach that produces insulin. Pancreatic cancer is hard to catch early. Find out about risk factors and symptoms.

title: Pancreatic Diseases
summary: Pancreatic diseases include pancreatitis, pancreatic cancer, and cystic fibrosis. The pancreas also plays a role in type 1 and type 2 diabetes.

title: Pancreatitis
summary: Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas. Pancreatitis can be acute or chronic. Learn about pancreatitis symptoms and treatment.

title: Panic Disorder
summary: Get the facts on panic disorders (a type of anxiety disorder), which can happen anytime, anywhere and without warning.

title: Paralysis
summary: Paralysis is a loss of muscle function in part of your body, when messages between the brain and muscles are disrupted. Learn about causes and coping.
alternative_names: Hemiplegia; Palsy; Paraplegia; Quadriplegia

title: Parasitic Diseases
summary: Parasitic diseases are diseases transmitted by parasites, usually found in contaminated food, water or bug bites. Protect yourself with these tips.

title: Parathyroid Disorders
summary: Too much or too little parathyroid hormone affects the right balance of calcium and phosphorous in your body, which can lead to parathyroid disorders.

title: Parenting
summary: Parenting styles differ from person to person. However, one thing you should always be aware of is your child's safety. Find more parenting tips.

title: Parkinson's Disease
summary: Parkinson's disease (PD) is a movement disorder. It causes tremors, stiffness, and slow movement. It gets worse over time. Learn what can help.
alternative_names: Paralysis agitans; Shaking palsy

title: Patient Rights
summary: Patient rights differ from state to state but one common patient right is informed consent. Read more about informed consent and how it can impact you.

title: Patient Safety
summary: Patient safety is something everyone should be aware of for the reduction of medical errors. Read about what you can start doing as a patient.

title: Pelvic Floor Disorders
summary: Pelvic floor disorders happen when your pelvic floor muscles get weak or injured. Common causes are pregnancy and childbirth. Learn about treatments.
alternative_names: Cystocele; Enterocele; Pelvic prolapse; Rectocele

title: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
summary: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) is inflammation and infection of a woman's reproductive organs. If untreated, it may cause infertility. Read more.
alternative_names: PID

title: Pelvic Pain
summary: Pelvic pain in the area below your belly button may be caused by different reasons. Talk to your doctor about your specific symptoms and available medical tests.

title: Pemphigus
summary: Pemphigus and bullous pemphigoid are an autoimmune disorder, affects cells in your skin and mouth. Learn about symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment.

title: Penis Disorders
summary: Penis disorders can cause pain and affect a man's sexual function and fertility. Read about the types of problems, including symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: Penile disorders

title: Peptic Ulcer
summary: Dull and burning stomach pain are common symptoms of a peptic ulcer. Read about tests that help detect stomach ulcers and get relief for your belly.
alternative_names: Duodenal ulcer; Gastric ulcer; Stomach ulcer; Ulcer

title: Pericardial Disorders
summary: The pericardium is a membrane that surrounds the heart. Pericardial disorders include pericarditis, pericardial effusion, and cardiac tamponade.

title: Period Pain
summary: Period pain affects many women, and it can be severe. Learn about the cause of menstrual cramps, what you can do to feel better, and when you need to see a doctor.
alternative_names: Dysmenorrhea; Menstrual cramps; Menstrual pain

title: Peripheral Arterial Disease
summary: Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) happens when there is a narrowing of the blood vessels outside of your heart. Learn about symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: PAD

title: Peripheral Nerve Disorders
summary: Peripheral nerves are nerves outside your brain and spinal cord. Learn about neuropathy and more than 100 other types of peripheral nerve disorders.
alternative_names: Neuritis; Peripheral neuritis; Peripheral neuropathy

title: Peritoneal Disorders
summary: Your peritoneum lines your abdominal wall. Disorders of the peritoneum aren't common but  include peritonitis, cancer and complications from dialysis.

title: Personal Health Records
summary: Your medical office has your personal health records but it's good for you to create one for yourself too. Find out what you should include on it.
alternative_names: Electronic health records; Patient health record

title: Personality Disorders
summary: People with personality disorders have trouble dealing with everyday stresses and problems. There are many types of personality disorders. Read more.

title: Pesticides
summary: Pesticides can help get rid of pests. Pesticides can protect your health by killing germs, animals, or plants that could hurt you.
alternative_names: Fungicides; Herbicides; Rodenticides

title: Pet Health
summary: Keeping your pet healthy is your responsibility as a pet owner. Know the signs of medical problems and what to look out for.

title: Phenylketonuria
summary: In phenylketonuria (PKU), your body can't process phenylalanine, an amino acid in most foods. Read about genetics, screening, and special diets.
alternative_names: PKU

title: Pheochromocytoma
summary: Pheochromocytoma is a rare tumor. Pheochromocytomas often cause the adrenal gland to make too many hormones. This can lead to high blood pressure.

title: Phobias
summary: A phobia is a type of anxiety disorder. There are many specific phobias. Treatment helps most people with phobias.

title: Piercing and Tattoos
summary: Tattoos and piercings are popular forms of body art that can be associated with serious health risks. Read this before getting new ink or piercings.
alternative_names: Body art; Body piercing

title: Pink Eye
summary: Pink Eye (conjunctivitis) is inflammation of the outer layer of the eye and inside of the eyelid. Read about the symptoms, causes, and treatment.
alternative_names: Conjunctivitis

title: Pinworms
summary: Pinworms are small parasites that spread easily. The eggs can live on household surfaces for up to 2 weeks. The infection is more common in children.
alternative_names: Enterobiasis; Oxyuriasis; Seatworm infection; Threadworm infection

title: Pituitary Disorders
summary: Your pituitary gland makes hormones. With a pituitary disorder, you have too much or too little of one of these hormones. Learn about these disorders.

title: Pituitary Tumors
summary: Pituitary tumors are common. The most common type of pituitary tumor produces hormones and disrupts the balance of hormones in your body.

title: Plague
summary: Plague is an infection caused by bacteria found mainly in rats and in the fleas that feed on them. There are three forms of plague.
alternative_names: Bubonic plague; Pneumonic plague

title: Plastic and Cosmetic Surgery
summary: Cosmetic surgery is performed to reshape the appearance of body parts. Cosmetic surgery can create physical changes and changes in self-esteem.
alternative_names: Cosmetic surgery

title: Platelet Disorders
summary: Platelets help wounds heal and prevent bleeding by forming blood clots. Learn about problems from having too few, too many, or abnormal platelets.
alternative_names: Thrombocyte disorders

title: Pleural Disorders
summary: Pleura is the tissue that wraps around the outside of your lungs. Pleural disorders include pleurisy, pleural effusion and pneumothorax. Learn more.

title: Pneumococcal Infections
summary: Pneumococcal infections can be mild or severe. The most common types of infections are Meningitis, Sepsis, Pneumonia, and ear and sinus infections
alternative_names: Streptococcus pneumoniae infections

title: Pneumocystis Infections
summary: Pheumocystis Infections are caused by a fungus in the lungs. The most common is pneumocystis pneumonia. Read about the first signs of this infection.

title: Pneumonia
summary: Pneumonia is an infection in one or both of the lungs. Symptoms of pneumonia vary to mild to severe. Read about the signs of pneumonia.
alternative_names: Bronchopneumonia

title: Poison Ivy, Oak, and Sumac
summary: Spending time outdoors could result in contact with poison ivy, oak or sumac plants. Most people are sensitive, they can cause a blistering skin rash.
alternative_names: Ivy poison; Rhus dermatitis; Toxicodendron dermatitis

title: Poisoning
summary: A poison is any substance that is harmful to your body. The effects of poisoning range from short-term illness to brain damage, coma, and death.

title: Polio and Post-Polio Syndrome
summary: Poliovirus is very contagious. Get the facts on polio and post-polio syndrome. Take precautions when travelling and learn about the polio vaccine.
alternative_names: Infantile paralysis; PPS; Poliomyelitis

title: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
summary: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) happens when a woman's ovaries or adrenal glands produce more male hormones than normal. Learn the symptoms of PCOS and treatments.
alternative_names: PCOS; Stein-Leventhal Syndrome

title: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
summary: Polymyalgia rheumatica (PMR) is a disorder that causes muscle pain and stiffness in your neck, shoulders and hips. Read about diagnosis and treatment.

title: Porphyria
summary: Porphyrias are a group of genetic disorders caused by problems with how your body makes a substance called heme. Read more about types and symptoms.

title: Post-COVID Conditions (Long COVID)
summary: Anyone who had COVID-19, whether is was severe or mild, can have long-lasting symptoms. Learn more about Post-COVID conditions (long COVID), including symptoms, diagnosis, treatments, and prevention.
alternative_names: Chronic COVID; Long-haul COVID; Long-term effects of COVID

title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
summary: You can get Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) after experiencing a traumatic event. PTSD starts at different times for different people.
alternative_names: PTSD

title: Postpartum Care
summary: It is important to take care of yourself post-pregnancy. Postpartum care includes managing physical and emotional challenges after your baby is born.
alternative_names: Post-pregnancy health

title: Postpartum Depression
summary: Postpartum (post-pregnancy) depression can begin anytime within the first year after childbirth. Learn about the symptoms of postpartum depression.
alternative_names: Post-pregnancy depression

title: Potassium
summary: Potassium is a mineral that the body needs to work normally. Read more about potassium and learn about potassium rich foods to add to your diet.

title: Prader-Willi Syndrome
summary: Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS) is a rare genetic disorder. It causes poor muscle tone, low levels of sex hormones and a constant feeling of hunger.
alternative_names: PWS

title: Preconception Care
summary: Preconception care is care you receive before you get pregnant. It involves taking care of problems that might affect you and your baby later.

title: Prediabetes
summary: Prediabetes happens when your blood sugar levels are higher than normal but not high enough to be called diabetes.

title: Pregnancy
summary: During pregnancy, you'll have many questions. Learn about which symptoms and body changes are normal, as well as how to keep yourself and your baby healthy.

title: Pregnancy and Medicines
summary: Not all medicines are safe to take when you are pregnant. Some medicines can harm your baby, including over-the-counter drugs, herbs and supplements.

title: Pregnancy and Nutrition
summary: During pregnancy, it's important to give yourself and your baby the nutrition needed to grow and be healthy. Learn which foods can give you the right nutrients.

title: Pregnancy and Opioids
summary: There are risks to you and your baby if you take opioids while pregnant. Learn about these risks and the treatments for opioid use disorder (OUD) in pregnancy.

title: Pregnancy and Substance Use
summary: During pregnancy, substance use can harm your baby. Learn about why to stay away from smoking, drinking, and illegal drugs, and how to get help.

title: Premature Babies
summary: A premature birth is when a baby is born before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy. Premature babies may have health problems and need special care.
alternative_names: Preemies

title: Premenstrual Syndrome
summary: For some women, premenstrual syndrome (PMS) may be so severe it can interfere with normal activities. Find out what you can do to lessen symptoms.
alternative_names: PMS

title: Prenatal Care
summary: Getting the right prenatal care is important for a healthy pregnancy. Learn what exams or tests you need so you can the most out of your appointments.

title: Prenatal Testing
summary: Learn how prenatal testing checks on the health of you and your baby during pregnancy. Some tests are routine, and some are for women at high risk.

title: Prescription Drug Misuse
summary: Prescription drug misuse happens if you take a medicine in a way that is different from what the doctor prescribed. Misusing some drugs can lead to addiction.
alternative_names: Prescription Drug Abuse

title: Pressure Sores
summary: Bedsores (decubitus ulcers) are caused by pressure to areas of skin when resting in a position for too long. Complications can be serious. Learn why.
alternative_names: Bed sores; Decubitus ulcers; Pressure ulcers

title: Preterm Labor
summary: Preterm labor is labor that begins before the 37th week of pregnancy. Learn what signs to look for in a preterm labor such as cramps or bleeding.
alternative_names: Early Labor; Premature Birth; Premature Labor; Preterm Birth

title: Primary Ovarian Insufficiency
summary: Primary ovarian insufficiency(POI) happens when a woman's ovaries stop working before she is 40. POI is different from premature menopause. Learn about the causes, and how to treat the symptoms and complications.
alternative_names: Ovarian insufficiency; POF; POI; Premature ovarian failure

title: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy
summary: Progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) is a rare brain disease. It causes problems with balance, eye movement, and walking. Learn about what can help.
alternative_names: PSP; Richardson-Steele-Olszewski syndrome; Steele-Richardson-Olszewski syndrome

title: Prostate Cancer
summary: Prostate cancer is one of the most common types of cancer among American men. The risk goes up as men age. Learn about symptoms, tests, and treatment.

title: Prostate Cancer Screening
summary: Prostate cancer screening, which may include a PSA blood test, may be able to find prostate cancer early. Talk to your doctor to see if you should be screened.

title: Prostate Diseases
summary: A man's prostate grows as he gets older, increasing the risk of problems. Learn about the different types of prostate problems, including prostatitis.

title: Psoriasis
summary: Psoriasis is a skin disease that causes itchy or sore patches of thick, red skin with silvery scales. Some people also get psoriasis arthritis.

title: Psoriatic Arthritis
summary: Psoriasis is a skin disease that causes itchy or sore patches of thick, red skin with silvery scales. Find out about symptoms and treatment.

title: Psychotic Disorders
summary: Psychotic disorders are severe mental disorders that cause abnormal thinking and perceptions. Two main symptoms are delusions and hallucinations. Learn more.
alternative_names: Psychoses

title: Puberty
summary: Puberty is the time in life when a boy or girl becomes sexually mature. It causes physical changes, and affects boys and girls differently.

title: Pubic Lice
summary: Pubic lice, or crabs, are tiny parasitic insects. They usually live in the pubic area, and most often spread through sexual contact. Find out how to tell if you have them, and how to treat them.
alternative_names: Crabs

title: Pulmonary Embolism
summary: A pulmonary embolism is a sudden blockage in a lung artery. The cause is usually a blood clot in the leg called deep vein thrombosis. Learn more.
alternative_names: Blood clots in the lung

title: Pulmonary Fibrosis
summary: Pulmonary fibrosis (Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis or IPF) is a condition where the tissue deep in the lungs becomes scarred over time. Find symptoms.
alternative_names: IPF; Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

title: Pulmonary Hypertension
summary: Pulmonary hypertension (PH) is high blood pressure in the arteries to your lungs. It makes your heart work harder, which can lead to heart failure.
alternative_names: Pulmonary arterial hypertension

title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
summary: Pulmonary Rehabilitation is a medically supervised program to help people with chronic breathing problems, like COPD or cystic fibrosis. Learn more.

title: Quitting Smoking
summary: Quitting smoking is important for your health. Tobacco use is the most common preventable cause of death. Find the best way for you to quit.
alternative_names: Smoking cessation

title: Rabies
summary: Rabies is a deadly animal disease caused by a virus. People get it from the bite of an infected animal. Learn about treatments.
alternative_names: Hydrophobia

title: Radiation Emergencies
summary: A radiation emergency involves exposure to a large amount of radiation. Learn about ways to cope with possible situations and make a disaster plan.

title: Radiation Exposure
summary: Radiation exposure to even small amounts over a long time, raises your risk of cancer. A lot over a short time, causes burns or radiation sickness.

title: Radiation Therapy
summary: Radiation therapy is cancer treatment, using exposure to kill and stop spread. Must be carefully done to minimize side effects and maximize benefits.
alternative_names: Brachytherapy; Radiotherapy

title: Radon
summary: Radon comes from the natural breakdown of uranium in soil, rock, and water.  It is the second leading cause of lung cancer. Test your home for radon levels.

title: Rare Diseases
summary: A rare disease is one that affects fewer than 200,000 people in the United States. There are nearly 7,000, affecting more than 25 million Americans.

title: Rashes
summary: A rash, or dermatitis, is an area of irritated or swollen skin. It can be itchy, red, and painful. Learn about the types, causes, and treatments.
alternative_names: Dermatitis; Skin rash

title: Raynaud Phenomenon
summary: Raynaud phenomenon is a disorder of the blood vessels. It causes your fingers and toes to become cold and numb when you get cold or stressed. Learn more.
alternative_names: Raynaud's disease; Raynaud's syndrome

title: Rectal Disorders
summary: The rectum is the lower part of your large intestine. Common problems include hemorrhoids, abscesses, incontinence and cancer.

title: Reflux in Children
summary: Kids can get reflux and GERD, which happen when stomach contents leak back up. Learn the difference between the two, and the symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: GER in Children; GERD in Children

title: Reflux in Infants
summary: Many babies spit up, or have reflux, and some have the more serious GERD. Learn the difference between the two, and their symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: GER in Infants; GERD in infants; Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux

title: Refractive Errors
summary: Are you nearsighted, farsighted, or have astigmatism? That's a refractive error, caused by an irregular-shaped cornea or lens. Learn how it's treated.
alternative_names: Farsightedness; Hyperopia; Myopia; Nearsightedness

title: Rehabilitation
summary: Rehabilitation is the process that assists a person in recovering from a serious injury, illness or surgery to regain strength, or relearn skills.
alternative_names: Rehab

title: Reproductive Hazards
summary: Reproductive hazards can affect your reproductive health, fertility, and ability to have healthy children. Learn about the types and prevention.

title: Respiratory Failure
summary: Respiratory failure happens when not enough oxygen passes from your lungs to your blood. Lung diseases can cause respiratory failure. Read more.

title: Respiratory Syncytial Virus Infections
summary: Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) causes cold-like symptoms in adults and healthy children, but can cause serious problems in babies. Read more.
alternative_names: RSV

title: Restless Legs
summary: That creeping, crawling, tingling, or burning feeling in your legs when lying down or sitting may be restless leg syndrome (RLS). Learn what can help.
alternative_names: RLS; Willis-Ekbom Disease

title: Retinal Detachment
summary: The retina is in the back of your eye. It senses light and sends images to your brain. A detachment (pulling away) is an emergency. Know the symptoms.

title: Retinal Disorders
summary: The retina is a layer of tissue in the back of your eye. It senses light and sends images to your brain. Learn about retinal disorders and treatments.

title: Rett Syndrome
summary: Rett syndrome is a rare genetic disease. It causes developmental and nervous system problems, mostly in girls. Learn about symptoms and treatments.

title: Reye Syndrome
summary: Learn about Reye syndrome, which affects the liver, brain, and other organs. It is rare, and is often in children who have just had a viral infection.

title: Rh Incompatibility
summary: Rh incompatibility happens during pregnancy if mom's blood is Rh-negative and the baby's is Rh-positive. Learn about screening and treatment.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis
summary: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) causes pain, swelling and loss of joint function. Treatments include medicine, lifestyle changes, and surgery. Learn more.
alternative_names: RA

title: Rickets
summary: Rickets causes soft, weak bones in children. It usually occurs when they do not get enough vitamin D. Read about symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: Rachitis

title: Rosacea
summary: Rosacea can range from redness in the face to acne and thickened skin and inflammation that may extend into the eyes. Learn what treatments can help.
alternative_names: Acne rosacea

title: Rotator Cuff Injuries
summary: The rotator cuff is made up of muscles and tendons in your shoulder area. Tendinitis, bursitis, and tears are common problems with the rotator cuff.

title: Rotavirus Infections
summary: Rotavirus is a virus that causes symptoms of severe diarrhea, vomiting, fever, and dehydration.  It is easily spread; but vaccines are available.

title: Rubella
summary: Rubella (German measles) is a viral infection. It's usually mild, but can be dangerous for an unborn baby if the mother gets it. Read about prevention
alternative_names: German measles; Three day measles

title: Rural Health Concerns
summary: People in rural, remote areas can face different health issues than people living in towns and cities, such as even being able to get health care.

title: Safe Opioid Use
summary: Opioids are strong pain relievers. People who take them are at risk for opioid use disorder (OUD) and overdose. These risks increase when opioids are misused.

title: Safety
summary: You cannot remove all the safety hazards from life, but you can reduce them. Learn how to avoid many major hazards and prepare for emergencies.
alternative_names: Accident prevention

title: Salivary Gland Cancer
summary: Salivary glands empty saliva into your mouth. Salivary gland cancer is a rare type of head and neck cancer. Learn about the associated symptoms.

title: Salivary Gland Disorders
summary: Salivary gland disorders may affect your ability to make saliva. Read about some of the causes of irritated and swollen glands such as mumps.

title: Salmonella Infections
summary: Salmonella is a group of bacteria that is a common cause of foodborne illness. Learn the symptoms. Know when to, and who should see a doctor.

title: Sarcoidosis
summary: Sarcoidosis is a disease that leads to inflammation, usually in lungs, skin, or lymph nodes. It starts as granulomas. Discover symptoms and tests.

title: Scabies
summary: Scabies is an itchy skin condition caused by the microscopic mite Sarcoptes scabei. Common all over the world and can affect anyone, learn treatments.

title: Scars
summary: A scar is a permanent patch of skin that grows over a wound. It forms as your body heals itself. Learn about types, including keloids, and treatments.
alternative_names: Cicatrix; Keloid scar

title: Schizophrenia
summary: Schizophrenia is a serious brain illness that can include hearing voices that aren't there and  thinking others are trying to hurt them.

title: School Health
summary: Your child spends more time at school than anywhere else except home. Schools affect children's health from learning healthy behaviors to exercise.

title: Sciatica
summary: Sciatica is a symptom of a problem with the sciatic nerve causing pain, weakness, numbness, or tingling. Read about causes, tests, and treatment.

title: Scleroderma
summary: Scleroderma is an autoimmune disease that causes inflammation and thickening in the skin and other areas of the body. The exact cause of scleroderma is unknown.
alternative_names: Circumscribed scleroderma; Dermatosclerosis; Morphea; Systemic sclerosis

title: Scoliosis
summary: Scoliosis causes a sideways curve of your backbone, or spine. It is most common in late childhood and early teens. Find out more.

title: Seasonal Affective Disorder
summary: Seasonal affective disorder or SAD is a type of depression experienced by some people during the winter months, when there is less natural sunlight.
alternative_names: SAD; Seasonal depression; Seasonal mood disorder

title: Secondhand Smoke
summary: Secondhand smoke is smoke that comes from the burning end of a cigarette, cigar, or pipe, and the smoke breathed out by the smoker affecting others.
alternative_names: Environmental tobacco smoke; Passive smoking; Tobacco smoke pollution

title: Seizures
summary: Seizures are caused by sudden, abnormal electrical activity in the brain. They can be mild or severe. Learn about the types, causes, and treatments.

title: Self-Harm
summary: Self-harm refers to a person harming themselves on purpose. About 1 in 100 people experience this. Learn ways to find relief and cope with emotions.
alternative_names: Self-injury

title: Sepsis
summary: Sepsis is a serious illness and can lead to a life threatening condition called septic shock. Read about symptoms, treatment and risk factors for sepsis.

title: Sexual Assault
summary: Sexual assault is any kind of sexual activity, contact, or experience that happens without your consent. It is never the victim's fault. Learn more.
alternative_names: Rape

title: Sexual Health
summary: Sexuality is part of life. Learn about what leads to better sexual health, as well as the problems that can affect your ability to have or enjoy sex.

title: Sexual Problems in Men
summary: Learn about the causes of sexual problems in men and how to treat them. Causes may be physical, hormonal, psychological, or due to medicines.

title: Sexual Problems in Women
summary: Learn about the causes of sexual problems in women and how to treat them. Causes may be physical, hormonal, psychological, or due to medicines.

title: Sexually Transmitted Infections
summary: Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) are passed from person to person during sexual contact. Testing, vaccines, and prevention behaviors can lower your risk.
alternative_names: STDs; STIs; Sexually transmitted diseases; Venereal disease

title: Shingles
summary: Learn about shingles (herpes zoster), which is a painful rash, often on one side of the body. It is caused by the same virus that causes chickenpox.
alternative_names: Herpes zoster; Postherpetic neuralgia

title: Shock
summary: Shock happens when not enough blood and oxygen can get to your organs and tissues. It can be life threatening. Find out about symptoms and treatment.

title: Shoulder Injuries and Disorders
summary: Your shoulders can be affected by injuries such as sprains, strains and rotator cuff tear. Learn how to treat and prevent shoulder pain and injury.

title: Sickle Cell Disease
summary: Sickle cell disease is a group of inherited disorders that affect your red blood cells. It can cause pain, anemia, and other problems. Learn about treatments.
alternative_names: Hemoglobin SS disease; Sickle cell anemia

title: Sinusitis
summary: Sinusitis (inflamed sinuses) is sometimes caused by an infection, but there are several types (such as chronic or recurrent). Find all the symptoms.

title: Sjogren's Syndrome
summary: Sjogren's Syndrome is an autoimmune disease that causes dryness of the mouth, eyes and other parts of the body. Learn how to relieve the symptoms.

title: Skin Aging
summary: Direct sunlight on unprotected skin and lifestyle factors can affect skin aging. Find ways to revamp your skin care routine to reduce premature aging.

title: Skin Cancer
summary: Try ABCDE on a mole to check for signs of skin cancer: Asymmetry, Border, Color, Diameter, Elevation. Learn more on advanced detection and treatments.

title: Skin Conditions
summary: Your skin is your body's largest organ. It covers and protects your body. Learn about skin conditions, including causes, symptoms, and treatment.
alternative_names: Cutaneous disorders; Dermatologic disorders

title: Skin Infections
summary: Skin infections can be caused by bacteria, virus, fungus, or parasites. Impetigo is a type among kids. Shingles is a reactivation of chickenpox virus.

title: Skin Pigmentation Disorders
summary: Read about skin pigmentation disorders, which affect the color of your skin. It could be too light or too dark, in certain areas or all over the body.
alternative_names: Hyperpigmentation; Hypopigmentation

title: Sleep Apnea
summary: Sleep apnea is a common disorder that causes your breathing to stop or get very shallow while you sleep. Discover sleep apnea symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: Sleep-disordered breathing

title: Sleep Disorders
summary: Getting a good sleep is vital to your health, but many Americans don't get enough. Learn about sleep disorders, treatments, and good sleep habits.

title: Small Intestine Disorders
summary: Your small intestine connects your stomach to your large intestine (or colon). Find out about different diseases and disorders of the small intestine.

title: Smallpox
summary: Smallpox is an infectious disease caused by the Variola virus. It is contagious and has killed thousands. Find a list of symptoms related to smallpox

title: Smokeless Tobacco
summary: Those who enjoy chewing tobacco think it's safer than smoking. But smokeless tobacco can also cause dangerous risks. Read about them.
alternative_names: Chewing tobacco; Dip; Oral tobacco; Snuff; Spit tobacco

title: Smoking
summary: There's no way around it. Smoking is bad for your health. Learn the effects of smoking (how smoking harms nearly every organ) and how to quit.
alternative_names: Cigar smoking; Cigarette smoking; Pipe smoking; Tobacco smoking

title: Smoking and Youth
summary: The younger you are when you start smoking, the more health problems it can cause. Know the risks of smoking cigarettes for people under age 21.
alternative_names: Teen smoking

title: Snoring
summary: Snoring is the sound you make when your breathing is blocked while you are asleep. Learn common causes. Find treatments available to reduce snoring.

title: Sodium
summary: Did you know that most Americans get more sodium than they need? Read about what you can do to manage your sodium intake
alternative_names: Salt

title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma
summary: Soft tissue sarcoma refers to cancer that begins in the muscle, fat, vessels or tendons. It can cause a lump or swelling. See which treatments are available

title: Sore Throat
summary: Sore throat or pharyngitis has many causes including allergies, smoking, strep throat, and mononucleosis. Find treatments options depending on cause.
alternative_names: Pharyngitis

title: Speech and Communication Disorders
summary: Speech and communication disorders affect our ability to communicate. From saying sounds incorrectly to being unable to understand others talking.
alternative_names: Communication disorders

title: Speech and Language Problems in Children
summary: It can be hard to know if your child's speech or language delay is a problem. Read about the types of problems and how they are diagnosed and treated.

title: Spider Bites
summary: Spider bites generally garner a reaction similar to that of a bee sting, including redness, pain and swelling. Find tips on how to treat spider bites

title: Spina Bifida
summary: Spina bifida is a type of birth defect of an unborn baby's brain, spine, or spinal cord. Screening tests during pregnancy can detect.
alternative_names: Cleft spine; Open spine

title: Spinal Cord Diseases
summary: Read about diseases of the spinal cord, the bundle of nerves running down the middle of your back. It carries signals between the brain and the body.

title: Spinal Cord Injuries
summary: Spinal cord injuries disrupt signals between your brain and body. This can cause problems like weakness and paralysis. Read about treatment and rehab.

title: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
summary: Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) attacks nerve cells in the spinal cord, weakening voluntary muscles. Read about the genetics, types, and what may help.
alternative_names: SMA

title: Spinal Stenosis
summary: Spinal stenosis causes narrowing in your spine which puts pressure on your nerves and spinal chord. It can cause pain, numbness, and foot problems.

title: Spine Injuries and Disorders
summary: Spine injuries and spine disorders such as infection, scoliosis, and herniated disk can cause pain and other issues. Read about problems of the spine.

title: Spleen Diseases
summary: The spleen is an organ above the stomach, under the ribs. Certain diseases may cause a spleen to swell. A damaged spleen may need removed. Read more.
alternative_names: Splenic diseases

title: Sports Fitness
summary: Sports are a great way to get or stay in shape. Find tips on what you can do before and after your sports fitness session to maintain your health

title: Sports Injuries
summary: Get the facts on sports injuries, including the most common types, and read about the treatments available

title: Sports Safety
summary: If you play sports, your safety should be a priority. Learn how to prevent related injuries by taking the following precautions

title: Sprains and Strains
summary: A sprain is a stretch or tear of a ligament while a strain is an injury to a muscle or tendon. Learn how to lower your risks of sprains and strains.

title: Staphylococcal Infections
summary: Staph infections are caused by bacteria that are commonly found on the skin or in the nose. Learn how to prevent and treat Staph infections.
alternative_names: Staph

title: Statins
summary: If diet and exercise don't reduce your cholesterol levels, you may need to take medicine. Often, this medicine is a statin. Learn more about statins.
alternative_names: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors

title: Stem Cells
summary: There are two main types of stem cells: embryonic stem cells and adult stem cells. Read about three ways stem cells differ from other cells in the body

title: Steroids
summary: Anabolic steroids are often used illegally to build muscle. But corticosteroids are used to treat a variety of health problems. Learn more about steroids.
alternative_names: Corticosteroids; Glucocorticoids

title: Stillbirth
summary: A stillbirth is when a mother's baby dies in the womb after the 20th week of pregnancy. Read more on how to cope or support your loved one.

title: Stomach Cancer
summary: Did you know risk factors for stomach (gastric) cancer include a diet high in salty or smoked food or having an H. pylori infection? Learn more here.
alternative_names: Gastric cancer

title: Stomach Disorders
summary: Have questions about what's causing your bellyache? Take a look at this information on stomach disorders. Find information on kids and adults.
alternative_names: Gastric disorders

title: Streptococcal Infections
summary: Streptococcal is a type of bacteria that can cause strep throat (group A) or blood infections (group B). Learn how they can be prevented and treated.
alternative_names: Strep

title: Stress
summary: Read about causes, symptoms and treatments associated with stress, something that most people encounter from time to time.
alternative_names: Psychological stress

title: Stroke
summary: A stroke happens when blood flow to the brain is blocked. It is a medical emergency. Quick action can save a life and help with rehabilitation and recovery.
alternative_names: Brain attack; CVA

title: Stroke Rehabilitation
summary: Strokes can cause lasting brain damage. Find out how stroke rehabilitation can help stroke survivors relearn skills they lose because of the damage.

title: Stuttering
summary: Learn about stuttering, or stammering, a speech disorder that affects the flow of your speech. It is more common in children, who often outgrow it.
alternative_names: Stammering

title: Sudden Cardiac Arrest
summary: In sudden cardiac arrest (SCA), an irregular heart rhythm causes the heart to stop beating. Without quick treatment, it causes sudden cardiac death. Find out more.
alternative_names: SCA; Sudden cardiac death

title: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome
summary: Learn how to reduce the risk of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS), which is the leading cause of death in children between 1 month and one year old
alternative_names: Crib death; SIDS

title: Suicide
summary: Suicide is the tenth most common cause of death in the United States. Read about the causes and treatment available, including a suicide hotline number

title: Sun Exposure
summary: Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the U.S. Reduce your risk by staying in the shade and wearing protective clothing, sunglasses, and sunscreen all year.
alternative_names: Sunburn

title: Surgery
summary: There are many reasons to have surgery, ranging from pain prevention to body adjustments. However, there are risks associated with it. Read about them
alternative_names: Operation

title: Swallowing Disorders
summary: Trouble swallowing (dysphagia) can happen with a number of neurological disorders. Older adults are at higher risk. Learn about causes and therapies.
alternative_names: Dysphagia

title: Sweat
summary: Sweating (perspiration) is how your body cools itself. Too much of it is hyperhidrosis, too little is anhidrosis. Find out what is and isn't normal.
alternative_names: Perspiration

title: Syphilis
summary: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted disease. It causes sores on the genitals, rectum, or mouth. Read about testing, prevention, and treatment.

title: Syringomyelia
summary: In syringomyelia, a cyst forms in your spinal cord. It gets bigger over time, destroying part of the spinal cord. Learn about causes and treatments.

title: Tailbone Disorders
summary: The tailbone, or coccyx, is at the bottom of your backbone, or spine. Learn about tailbone disorders and what problems cause pain in your coccyx.
alternative_names: Coccyx disorders

title: Talking With Your Doctor
summary: Good communication helps you make the most of your doctor visits. Learn how to talk about your concerns and get tips on preparing for talking with your doctor.

title: Tanning
summary: Did you know that a tan is actually sun damage? Learn about the dangers of both indoor and outdoor tanning, and how you can protect your skin.

title: Taste and Smell Disorders
summary: Taste and smell disorders can have many causes such as colds and head injuries. Some medications can also affect taste and smell.

title: Tay-Sachs Disease
summary: Tay-Sachs disease is a rare genetic disorder. It causes too much of a fatty substance to build up in the brain, which destroys nerve cells.

title: Tears
summary: Your tears clean your eyes and keep them moist. Read about tears and what can go wrong, like too many tears, too few tears, or tear duct problems.
alternative_names: Lacrimation

title: Teen Depression
summary: More and more teens in the U.S. have depression. It is a serious medical illness that causes feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and frustration that do not go away. Learn about diagnosis and treatment

title: Teen Development
summary: Puberty differs for each teenager. Not only does it affect the body, but it also affects the mental. Find tips to help you manage teen development
alternative_names: Adolescent development

title: Teen Health
summary: Teenagers go through many changes, primarily when it comes to body image. Read on how incorporating healthy habits can help them feel their best
alternative_names: Adolescent health

title: Teen Mental Health
summary: Being a teenager can be stressful, and some teens will struggle with their mental health. But help is available. Learn the warning signs and when to get help.

title: Teen Sexual Health
summary: During your teens you go through puberty and become sexually mature. Whether you choose to have sex or not, you should know how sex affects your health.

title: Teen Violence
summary: Teen violence refers to harmful behaviors that can start early and continue into young adulthood. Read about violent behavior and what to do about it.
alternative_names: Youth violence

title: Teenage Pregnancy
summary: Get the facts on teenage pregnancy - how common it is, prevention, and how teenage mothers can have a safe and healthy pregnancy.
alternative_names: Adolescent pregnancy

title: Telehealth
summary: Telehealth is the use of communications technologies to provide health care from a distance. Learn about the benefits, problems, and the types of care available using telehealth.
alternative_names: Telemedicine

title: Temporomandibular Disorders
summary: Temporomandibular disorders (TMDs) affect the joints that connect your lower jaw to your skull. TMDs can cause jaw pain and stiffness. Learn about treatments.
alternative_names: TMD; TMJ disorders; Temporomandibular joint dysfunction

title: Tendinitis
summary: Do you have pain and soreness around your joint? You could have tendinitis, or swelling of a tendon. Read about who is at risk and how to treat it.
alternative_names: Tendonitis

title: Testicular Cancer
summary: Testicular cancer mainly affects young men between the ages of 20 and 39. Symptoms include pain, swelling, or lumps in your testicles or groin area.

title: Testicular Disorders
summary: Testicular cancer mainly affects young men between the ages of 20 and 39. You can get cancer in one or both testicles. Know what to look out for.

title: Tetanus
summary: A vaccine can prevent tetanus. It is given as a part of routine childhood immunization. Adults should get a tetanus shot, or booster, every 10 years.

title: Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Pertussis Vaccines
summary: This page will teach you about combinations of vaccines for tetanus, diphtheria, and whooping cough. Find out who should get which vaccine and at what age to start.
alternative_names: DTaP; DTaP/Tdap/Td; Td; Td vaccination booster; Tdap; Tetanus booster

title: Thalassemia
summary: Thalassemias are inherited blood disorders. They affect your ability to make hemoglobin. This can cause anemia. Learn about the types and treatments.
alternative_names: Cooley's anemia; Mediterranean anemia

title: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
summary: In thoracic outlet syndrome (TOS), a compressed nerve or blood vessel causes pain in your arm, shoulder, and neck. Read about the types and treatment.
alternative_names: TOS

title: Throat Cancer
summary: Throat cancer has different names, depending on what part of the throat is affected (such as oropharynx). Learn the different symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: Hypopharyngeal cancer; Laryngeal cancer; Laryngopharyngeal cancer; Nasopharyngeal cancer; Oropharyngeal cancer; Pharyngeal cancer

title: Throat Disorders
summary: Throat problems are common and are usually caused by a viral infection. Learn more about problems that affect the throat.
alternative_names: Pharyngeal disorders

title: Thymus Cancer
summary: Thymus Cancer (thymoma) is rare. Symptoms include a cough that doesn’t go away, chest pain, and trouble breathing. Explore your treatment options.
alternative_names: Thymoma

title: Thyroid Cancer
summary: Your thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland in your neck. There are several thyroid cancer types with different treatments. Discover options available.

title: Thyroid Diseases
summary: The thyroid is a gland in the neck. The thyroid gland creates hormones that affect metabolism. Learn about thyroid diseases, such as hypothyroidism.

title: Thyroid Tests
summary: The thyroid is a gland in your neck that makes hormones. Read about blood and imaging tests that doctors use to diagnose and monitor thyroid diseases.
alternative_names: Thyroid panel

title: Tick Bites
summary: Tick bites can spread many diseases, including Lyme disease and Rocky Mountain spotted fever. Learn how to prevent tick bites and what to do if you get bitten.

title: Tinea Infections
summary: Tinea are skin diseases caused by fungus like ringworm or jock itch. Some are treated with over the counter items and others require prescription.
alternative_names: Ringworm

title: Tinnitus
summary: Tinnitus is often described as a ringing in the ears, but it can also sound like roaring, hissing, or buzzing. There are many causes. Read the list.

title: Toddler Development
summary: It is exciting to watch your toddler learn new skills. Toddlers do not develop at the same rate. Learn more about what to expect.

title: Toddler Health
summary: This page will teach you about toddler health. Learn about common warning signs of sickness and what to expect from routine health exams.

title: Toddler Nutrition
summary: Food provides nutrients a young child needs to be healthy. You are the most important influence on your child when it comes to diet. Learn more.

title: Toe Injuries and Disorders
summary: Toe injuries and disorders include turf toe, bunions, sprains, fractures, and ingrown toenails. Read up on what causes toe pain and what can treat it.

title: Tongue Disorders
summary: Your tongue helps you taste, swallow, and chew. You also use it to speak. Problems with the tongue can have many different causes. Learn more.

title: Tonsillitis
summary: Tonsillitis is an inflammation (swelling) of the tonsils. Learn the causes, symptoms, and treatment options for tonsillitis.
alternative_names: Tonsil Inflammation

title: Tooth Decay
summary: You call it a cavity. Your dentist calls it tooth decay or dental caries. They're all names for a hole in your tooth. Find out how to prevent it.
alternative_names: Cavities; Dental caries

title: Tooth Disorders
summary: There are a variety of problems associated with tooth disorders such as cavities and infections. Uncover the related symptoms, such as a toothache.

title: Tornadoes
summary: Although there are no guarantees of safety during a tornado, you can take actions to protect yourself. Read about what you can do.

title: Tourette Syndrome
summary: Tourette syndrome (TS) is a neurologic disorder, mostly in children. It causes tics - involuntary, unusual movements or sounds. Learn what can help.

title: Toxoplasmosis
summary: Toxoplasmosis is a disease caused by a common parasite. Most people with toxoplasmosis don't need treatment. Read about who is at risk.

title: Tracheal Disorders
summary: Problems with the trachea (windpipe) include narrowing and inflammation. You may need a tracheostomy to help you breathe. Learn about these disorders.
alternative_names: Windpipe disorders

title: Transient Ischemic Attack
summary: Transient ischemic attack (TIA) is a mini stroke. Even though the symptoms come and go, learn why TIA needs medical attention right away.
alternative_names: Mini-stroke; TIA

title: Traumatic Brain Injury
summary: Traumatic brain injury or TBI happens when a bump, blow, or other head injury causes damage to the brain. Treatment and outcome depend on how severe.
alternative_names: Acquired brain injury; TBI

title: Traveler's Health
summary: Traveling can increase your chances of getting sick. Learn what you need to do to protect yourself before you take off and during your trip.

title: Tremor
summary: Tremors are unintentional trembling or shaking movements in one or more parts of the body. Read about the types, such as essential tremor, and causes.

title: Trichomoniasis
summary: Trichomoniasis (or Trich) is an Sexually Transmitted Disease (STD) caused by a parasite. It is a common but curable infection. Get the information you need to get treatment.
alternative_names: Trich

title: Trigeminal Neuralgia
summary: Trigeminal neuralgia (TN or tic douloureux) causes extreme, sudden burning or shock-like pain in the face. Learn about the causes and treatments.
alternative_names: TN; Tic douloureux

title: Triglycerides
summary: Triglycerides are a type of fat in your blood. Having a high level may raise the risk of heart disease, especially in women. Learn how to lower it.

title: Tsunamis
summary: Although there are no guarantees of safety during a tsunami, you can take actions to protect yourself. Read about what you can do.

title: Tubal Ligation
summary: Tubal ligation (getting your fallopian tubes tied) is surgery to prevent a woman from getting pregnant. Learn more about this form of birth control.

title: Tuberculosis
summary: Tuberculosis (TB) is a disease caused by bacteria that attacks the lungs. Skin tests, blood tests, and x-rays can tell if you have TB. Learn more.
alternative_names: TB

title: Tuberous Sclerosis
summary: Tuberous sclerosis (TSC) is a rare genetic disease. It causes benign tumors in the brain and other organs. Learn about symptoms and what can help.
alternative_names: TSC; Tuberous sclerosis complex

title: Tumors and Pregnancy
summary: Tumors during pregnancy are rare, but they can happen. Treatment depends on the type of tumor, whether it has spread, and your overall health.

title: Turner Syndrome
summary: Turner syndrome is a genetic disorder that affects a girl's development. The cause is a missing or incomplete X chromosome. Learn more.

title: Twins, Triplets, Multiple Births
summary: Being pregnant with multiples raises your risk of pregnancy and childbirth problems. Learn how to stay healthy, prepare for birth, and plan for parenting.

title: Ulcerative Colitis
summary: Ulcerative Colitis (UC) can cause long-lasting swelling and ulcers in the large intestine. It is a type of inflammatory bowel disease. Find out more.
alternative_names: Colitis; Distal colitis; Pancolitis; Ulcerative proctitis

title: Uncommon Infant and Newborn Problems
summary: It can be scary when your baby is sick. You may not know whether the problem is serious or how to treat it. Read about what to do.

title: Underage Drinking
summary: Kids often begin drinking to look "cool" or fit in with their peers. Parents can help their kids avoid alcohol problems. Learn more.
alternative_names: Teenage drinking

title: Understanding Medical Research
summary: It seems to happen almost every day - you hear about the results of a new medical research study. Learn how to evaluate medical findings.

title: Ureteral Disorders
summary: Ureteral disorders occur when ureters become blocked or injured, which affect the flow of urine to the bladder. Read more about the ureter function

title: Urethral Disorders
summary: Urethral disorders may cause pain or your ability to urinate. Learn how the common disorders, urethritis and urethral stricture, affect each gender

title: Urinalysis
summary: A urinalysis is a test of your urine. Doctors use urine tests to find issues including UTI and diabetes. Learn about the test and what it checks for.
alternative_names: UA; Urine Analysis; Urine Test

title: Urinary Incontinence
summary: Urinary incontinence (UI), the loss of bladder control, is a common condition. Learn about the different types, symptoms, and causes of UI, and treatments.
alternative_names: Bladder control problems

title: Urinary Tract Infections
summary: You may have a urinary tract infection (UTI) if you feel a burn while urinating or suffer from lower body pressure. Uncover a list of UTI symptoms
alternative_names: UTI

title: Urine and Urination
summary: A healthy bladder can hold up to 16 ounces of urine for 2 to 5 hours. If this isn't the norm, read about the problems it may be attributed to.

title: Usher Syndrome
summary: Usher syndrome is an inherited disease that causes serious hearing loss and retinitis pigmentosa (eye disorder). Read the three types of the syndrome.

title: Uterine Cancer
summary: Uterine cancer is cancer of the uterus. The most common type, endometrial cancer, happens most often in women over 55. Know the symptoms and treatments.
alternative_names: Endometrial cancer

title: Uterine Diseases
summary: Uterine diseases are conditions that affect the uterus such as endometriosis, which is when tissue grows where it's not supposed to. Learn more here.

title: Uterine Fibroids
summary: Uterine fibroids are almost always non-cancerous. Symptoms may include heavy bleeding or frequent urination. Here's what you should know about fibroids.
alternative_names: Fibroids; Uterine leiomyomata

title: Vaccine Safety
summary: Vaccines protect you and your family from disease. Learn about vaccine safety in the United States. It includes a thorough process of testing and evaluating vaccines before they can be approved.

title: Vaccines
summary: Vaccines protect against life-threatening diseases. Follow a recommended immunization schedule to protect yourself and others at all stages of life.
alternative_names: Immunization; Vaccination

title: Vaginal Bleeding
summary: Vaginal bleeding is different from a period. It may last for weeks, or is between periods, before puberty, during pregnancy, or after menopause. Learn about the causes.
alternative_names: Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding; Uterine Bleeding

title: Vaginal Cancer
summary: Vaginal cancer is not very common and can be found early with a pap smear. Learn about risk factors such as HPV and the treatment options available.

title: Vaginal Diseases
summary: Vaginal diseases can cause uncomfortable symptoms like itching, burning, and pain. Read about vaginitis (inflammation) and other common vaginal problems.

title: Vaginitis
summary: Vaginitis, and vulvovaginitis, are an inflammation or infection of the vagina. They can cause itching, pain, discharge, and odor.  Learn about causes and treatment.

title: Valley Fever
summary: Valley Fever is a disease caused by a fungus called Coccidioides. You get it from inhaling the spores of the fungus. It's most common in older adults.
alternative_names: Coccidioidomycosis

title: Varicose Veins
summary: Varicose veins (or spider veins) are swollen, twisted veins that you can see just under the skin. Learn about how to keep them from getting worse.

title: Vascular Diseases
summary: Your vascular system is made up of blood vessels that carry blood to and from the heart. Learn about vascular diseases and their treatments.

title: Vasculitis
summary: Vasculitis, also called Angiitis, is an inflammation of the blood vessels. Learn about symptoms and treatment.
alternative_names: Angiitis

title: Vasectomy
summary: Vasectomy is a surgical form of birth control in men. Read about how it is done, and how it can sometimes be surgically reversed.

title: Vegetarian Diet
summary: A vegetarian diet focuses on plants for food.  There is no single type of vegetarian diet. Nutrients to focus on include protein, iron and calcium.

title: Veterans and Military Family Health
summary: Families of military service members and veterans face some unique challenges such as disruptions in parenting. Learn how families may be affected.

title: Veterans and Military Health
summary: Military service members and veterans face life-threatening injuries, mental health problems and problems from exposure to environmental hazards.

title: Viral Infections
summary: Viruses cause familiar infections such as the common cold, but they also cause severe illnesses. Learn more about viral infections and their symptoms.

title: Vision Impairment and Blindness
summary: Vision impairment (low vision) and blindness can have many causes. If you lose vision, you can't get it back. But there are ways to manage; learn how.
alternative_names: Low vision

title: Vital Signs
summary: Your vital signs show how well your body is functioning. They include blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate (or pulse), and temperature.

title: Vitamin A
summary: Vitamin A is an antioxidant. Vitamin A plays a role in your vision, bone growth, reproduction, cell functions and immune system.

title: Vitamin C
summary: Vitamin C is an antioxidant.  It is important for your skin, bones, and connective tissue. It promotes healing and helps the body absorb iron.
alternative_names: Ascorbic acid

title: Vitamin D
summary: Vitamin D helps your body absorb calcium. You can get Vitamin D in three ways: through your skin, from your diet, and from supplements.
alternative_names: Cholecalciferol; Ergocalciferol

title: Vitamin D Deficiency
summary: A lack of vitamin D (deficiency) can affect your bones and overall health. Learn who is at risk, how much vitamin D you need, and how to get enough.
alternative_names: Hypovitaminosis D; Low Vitamin D

title: Vitamin E
summary: Vitamin E is an antioxidant. It plays a role in your immune system and metabolic processes. People with certain disorders may need extra Vitamin E.

title: Vitamin K
summary: Vitamin K makes proteins for healthy bones and tissues. It also makes proteins for blood clotting. There are different types of vitamin K.

title: Vitamins
summary: Vitamins are substances that your body needs to grow and develop normally. There are 13 vitamins your body needs; Each has specific jobs.

title: Vitiligo
summary: Vitiligo causes white patches on your skin. It occurs when the cells that give your skin its color are destroyed. Learn about possible treatments.

title: VLDL Cholesterol
summary: VLDL is one of the "bad" types of cholesterol. Having too much can lead to a buildup of cholesterol in your arteries. Learn how to lower your VLDL level.

title: Voice Disorders
summary: Overusing your vocal cords can lead to various voice disorders such as polyps, nodules or sores on the cords. These signs may indicate a disorder.
alternative_names: Vocal disorders

title: Volcanoes
summary: A volcano is a vent in the Earth's crust. Volcanic gas and ash can damage the lungs of infants, older adults, and people with respiratory illnesses.

title: Von Hippel-Lindau Disease
summary: Von Hippel-Lindau disease (VHL) is a rare, genetic disease that causes tumors and cysts to grow in your body.
alternative_names: VHL

title: Vulvar Cancer
summary: Vulvar cancer is cancer of the labia or skin of a woman's genitals. It is very rare, but treatable. Having HPV is a risk factor. Get more details here.

title: Vulvar Disorders
summary: Vulvar disorders are conditions that affect the health of a woman's genitals such as pain, skin conditions, infections or cancer. Find out more.

title: Walking Problems
summary: The term "gait" refers to how a person walks. An abnormal gait might be caused by an underlying physical condition, disease or injury. Read more here.

title: Warts
summary: Warts or verruca are skin growths caused by an infection with humanpallilloma virus or HPV. Types of warts include common, plantar, genital and flat.
alternative_names: Verruca

title: Water Pollution
summary: Many different pollutants can harm our rivers, streams, lakes, and oceans. Learn how water pollution can cause plants to die and other problems.

title: Water Safety (Recreational)
summary: Playing in the water can be fun, but it can also be dangerous. Water safety can help prevent injuries and drowning. Learn how to stay safe.

title: Weight Control
summary: About two thirds of adults in the U.S. are overweight or obese. A weight control strategy can help you keep a healthy weight.

title: Weight Loss Surgery
summary: Is weight loss surgery for you? Learn about types of surgery including bariatric surgery, bypass surgery, gastric banding, and more.
alternative_names: Bariatric surgery; Bypass surgery; Gastric banding; Obesity surgery

title: West Nile Virus
summary: West Nile Virus (WNV) is a virus spread by mosquito bites. Most people have few to no symptoms. But some have severe symptoms. Learn about prevention and treatment.
alternative_names: WNV

title: Whooping Cough
summary: Whooping cough (Pertussis) is an infectious bacterial disease that causes uncontrollable coughing. Learn about the vaccine, symptoms, and treatment.
alternative_names: Pertussis

title: Wildfires
summary: Wildfires are extremely dangerous. They spread quickly and can destroy homes. Learn how to be prepared.
alternative_names: Forest Fire; Wildland Fire

title: Wilms Tumor
summary: Wilms' Tumor (or Nephroblastoma) is a rare type of cancer that affects one or both kidneys. Find a list of symptoms and treatments associated
alternative_names: Nephroblastoma

title: Wilson Disease
summary: Wilson disease is a disorder that prevents your body from getting rid of extra copper. Too much copper can affect the liver and nervous system.
alternative_names: Copper storage disease; Hepatolenticular degeneration

title: Winter Weather Emergencies
summary: Winter weather emergencies can lead to health and safety challenges. Take actions to protect yourself by having a disaster plan.

title: Women's Health
summary: Women have unique health issues throughout their lives. Preventive care and screening tests can help lower the risk of certain diseases, detect problems early, and improve outcomes.

title: Women's Health Checkup
summary: Women's health checkup exams and screenings may include a pelvic exam, pap test, mammogram, clinical breast exam and testing for HPV.

title: Wounds and Injuries
summary: Cuts, scratches, bruises, and lacerations are types of injuries of the skin or soft tissues. Find first aid tips and how to deal with accidents here.
alternative_names: Traumatic injuries

title: Wrist Injuries and Disorders
summary: Wrist pain can be caused by repetitive motions, injuries or other problems. Learn about various wrist disorders and injuries here.

title: X-Rays
summary: X-rays are a type of radiation called electromagnetic waves. X-ray imaging creates pictures of the inside of your body.
alternative_names: Radiography

title: Yeast Infections
summary: A yeast infection (also called candidiasis) is fungal infection that affects different body parts. Get the facts on it and associated problems.
alternative_names: Candidiasis; Moniliasis

title: Zika Virus
summary: Zika is a virus that is spread by mosquitoes. Most people who get the virus do not get sick. A blood test can tell if you have Zika.
alternative_names: Zika
